title: Pumpkin Risotto with Ricotta
description: Cut pumpkin flesh into thin slices. Set 8 of the slices aside and finely dice the rest. Sprinkle the slices with sugar and oil and wrap in aluminum foil. Season the diced pumpkin with salt and pepper and wrap in aluminum foil as well. Put both foil packets into a preheated oven at 200°C / 400°F for about 30 minutes. Peel and chop the onion and sauté in 1 tablespoon butter until soft. Add the rice and sauté briefly. Pour in the wine and let rice absorb it. Then add enough hot vegetable broth to just cover the rice, stirring, and keep adding broth as it is absorbed (for about 30 minutes). About 10 minutes before end of cooking, remove diced pumpkin from the oven, puree, and mix into the risotto. Before serving, melt the remaining butter with chile oil to taste, season with oregano, and set aside. Mix the Parmesan into the risotto and season with salt and pepper.

title: Risotto with Mushrooms and Bacon

Add rice and cook until translucent. Add wine and cook until completely reduced. Add a cup of broth and cook, stirring, until absorbed. Continue adding broth by the cupful, stirring constantly, until rice is tender and creamy, about 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Stuffed Grape Leaves with Dipping Sauce

title: Risotto with Mushrooms and Garlic

Add wine and cook, stirring continuously, until wine is fully absorbed. Add broth until rice is just covered and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook, stirring, until rice is tender and risotto has creamy consistency.

title: Risotto with Wild Garlic

title: Serbian-Style Vegetable Rice with Lamb (Djuvec)
description: Add the peppers and the eggplant and cook briefly. Grease a baking dish and line with half the tomatoes and top with some of the rice. Layer with half of the vegetables. Place the meat cubes on top and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Add the rest of the vegetables and then remaining rice. Layer the remaining tomato slices. Pour in the hot water and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with the remaining oil and cover with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven about 1.5 hours, adding more water as needed. Remove from oven and serve.

title: Fried Rice with Vegetables

title: Salmon Risotto with Saffron

Pour in half of the wine and let boil completely. Repeat with the remaining wine, then pour as much broth so that the rice is just covered. Stir in the saffron along with the soaking water, bay leaf and lemon zest. Pour a little broth and let boil again. Continue the process until the broth is exhausted and the rice is almost cooked, about 20-25 minutes (rice should still have a slight bite).

title: Savory Rice Cake with Sesame
description: Here comes a cornucopia of healthy vegetables from the springform pan: carrots provide us with cell-protecting beta-carotene, spinach scores points with plenty of folic acid, which promotes cell growth, and zucchini is a top supplier of iron. broccoli and paprika also provide plenty of vitamin C. This means that the body can absorb the iron particularly well.

description: Cook rice in 600 ml (approximately 2 1/2 cups) of boiling salted water.

title: Shrimp and Basil Risotto
description: Heat 1 teaspoon of butter in a pan. Cook onion and garlic until soft over medium heat. Reduce heat, add rice and sauté, stirring constantly. Add approximately 2 ladles of liquid to rice, simmer over low heat and stir until almost all the liquid is absorbed.

title: Brown Rice, Wheat Berry and Vegetable Casserole
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C / 350°F. Rinse and drain the rice and wheat berries and cook in about 3 3/4 cups of boiling salted water for about 15 minutes over low heat.

title: Mushroom Risotto with Pumpkin
description: Add broth until rice is just covered and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is evaporated. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, stirring frequently, for 20-25 minutes. After 10 minutes of cooking, add pumpkin cubes and mix.

title: Chicken Soup with Rice Noodles, Kale and Carrots
description: Strip the kale leaves from the stalks, rinse, and cook about 8 minutes until al dente in boiling salted water. Drain and chop coarsely.

title: Spicy Chicken with Risotto
description: Rinse the lime in hot water, wipe dry and peel with a sharp knife. Cut the peel into thin strips and finely chop half of them. Squeeze the lime. Mix the chopped lime zest with dried chile, honey, salt, pepper and soy sauce. Coat the chicken with the mixture, cover and let marinate about 20 minutes.

title: Exotic Rice Pudding with Coconut and Persimmons
description: For the vegan version of this dish, you exchange the cow's milk for a plant drink and the honey, for example, for coconut blossom sugar. The coconut milk rice is also very tasty with fresh mango or pears.

title: Rice Salad with Ham and Pineapple
description: In a colander, rinse the rice in cold water. Boil salt water that is double the amount of the rice. Cover and let soak for about 20 minutes over low heat. Then rinse thoroughly in a colander with cold water and drain.

title: Rice Patties with Vegetables
description: Cook rice according to package directions until al dente. Drain and let cool in a colander.

title: Baked Chicken and Rice
description: Deglaze with white wine and set aside. Drain the rice, mix with pineapple, chicken and zucchini, season and place the mixture into a greased baking dish. Drain the mozzarella, cut into thin slices and place on the chicken-rice mixture into the baking dish. Bake in preheated oven (180°C) (approximately 350°F) for about 15-20 minutes.

title: Vegetable Risotto
description: Add the rice, stirring constantly until translucent. Deglaze with white wine and let the liquid evaporate. Add half of the hot vegetable broth to the rice and over medium heat stir until the liquid has almost evaporated.

title: Fried Rice with Mixed Vegetables
description: You want a little variety? Then add some raisins or mango cubes to the pan. The sweet note rounds off the dish perfectly.

title: Peppers Stuffed with Rice
description: Cut off lids from red peppers, remove seeds and ribs (set aside the lids). Cut cheese into small cubes. Heat oil in a pan an saute apples and vegetables for about 5 minutes on medium heat, stirring. Add broth and sambal oelek, season with oregano and thyme. Add rice and cheese and stuff peppers with the mixture up to 2/3.

title: Baked Tomato Rice with Shrimp
description: Meanwhile, devein shrimp. Rinse and pat dry. Season with salt and cayenne pepper. Drizzle with lemon juice.

title: Asian Noodles with Shrimp
description: Rinse the prawns, pat dry and place in a bowl. Peel the garlic, chop or press, and combine with the lime juice and the soy sauce with the shrimp. Rinse the pepper, remove seeds and ribs and cut into fine strips. Rinse the chili, remove seeds and finely chop. Peel the ginger, cut first into thin slices, then cut into fine strips. Rinse the cilantro, shake dry and finely chop the leaves.

title: Rice Noodles with Prawns and Sprouts
description: Halve chile peppers, remove seeds, rinse and cut into fine pieces. Rinse scallions and cut into large pieces. Rinse bean sprouts in hot water. Peel garlic cloves and finely chop.

title: Risotto with Spinach
description: Add grated Parmesan, butter, spinach and basil to risotto and stir. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Risotto with Rhubarb and Tuna
description: Rinse, pat dry and cut tuna into cubes. Add grapeseed oil, lemon juice and zest to the fish. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Risotto with Saffron, Shrimp and Asparagus
description: While the rice cooks, rinse asparagus, trim ends and cut into 4-5 cm (approximately 1 1/2 to 2-inch) long pieces. Rinse shrimp and drain. Add asparagus and shrimp to rice about 5 minutes before the end of cooking. To serve, remove lemon zest and bay leaf, stir in Parmesan and remaining butter and season with salt and pepper.

title: Fish Stew with Rice
description: Bring rice to a boil in double amount of lightly salted water and allow to swell on the lowest heat.

title: Rice and Beans Pan with Beef
description: Heat the oil in a large frying pan and brown the beef cubes in it. Add the onion and saute shortly. Add the parboiled rice and stir fry until it is translucent. Add the bell peppers and tomato paste, and briefly fry. Stir in the beans and tomatoes with juice, and season with chile powder and salt. Pour the beef broth, bring to a boil, and simmer for about 20-30 minutes over low heat until the rice is cooked. Season with chile powder and salt, and sprinkle with parsley.

title: Fruity Pea Risotto
description: Finely grate the Parmesan. Stir in the remaining butter and the Parmesan. Serve immediately.

title: Kedgeree
description: Add the cream to the fish and gently heat. Add the rice to the pan and season with salt, pepper and turmeric. Fold in the scallions, eggs and chives and cook until heated through. Serve garnished with the reserved egg wedges.

title: Tomato Risotto
description: If desired, serve risotto arranged on large mushroom caps and accompanied by tomato sauce.

title: Beet Risotto
description: Wash, peel and grate the beet into the rice. Add lemon juice, boil everything again then turn off the heat and allow to stand for 5 minutes. Mix cream into the risotto, then add salt, pepper and cayenne pepper and serve garnished with basil.

title: Rice Pudding with Pine Nuts and Melon
description: Halve the melon, remove seeds, cut into wide wedges and slice. Melt butter in a pan, add sugar and cook over medium-low heat until caramelized. Add the melon slices to the pan and briefly swirl. Serve the rice pudding on deep plates, top with melon slices, pine nuts and lemon zest and serve garnished with mint leaves.

title: Orange-Scented Risotto with Sautéed Red Mullet
description: Dissolve the saffron in about 50 ml (approximately 1/4 cup) of hot broth. Pour the saffron broth into the risotto and let simmer, stirring occasionally. Cook, stirring frequently for 15-20 minutes, adding more broth as one amount has been absorbed until the rice is creamy with a slight bite.

title: Rice with Fruit
description: Rinse pepper, dry, halve and remove seeds and ribs. Cut into small cubes. Cut onion into a fine dice. Rinse scallions and cut in half lengthwise. Cut scallion strips into 0.5 cm (approximately 1/4 inch) pieces. Sauté pepper, onion and scallions in 1 tablespoon vegetable oil. Add broth and simmer about five minutes. Peel and core mango. Cut into pieces. Rinse raisins. Remove vegetables from pan and add to fruit. Sauté rice in pan in remaining oil. Divide vegetables between bowls, fill with rice and top with remaining vegetables. Serve hot with choice of fruit or vegetable garnish.

title: Rice with Chicken and Zucchini
description: Heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a saucepan, add rice and cook for 3 minutes until translucent. Add 800ml (approximately 3,5 cups) of vegetable stock. Crush saffron between  fingers, add to rice. Cover pan and cook rice for about 15 minutes or until it is almost done. Rinse and dry bell peppers. Halve peppers, remove seeds and ribs and cut into small cubes. Peel and finely chop onion and garlic. Rinse zucchini, cut off the ends and cut into small cubes. Rinse chicken, pat dry, cut into bite-sized pieces and season with salt, pepper and curry powder.

title: Asparagus Risotto
description: Peel onion and 3 cloves of garlic. Cut onions into small cubes, press garlic through garlic press. Heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a pan and saute onions until soft. Add garlic and cut asparagus and saute briefly. Add rice and saute until rice is translucent.  Add wine and cook, stirring, until all wine is absorbed.

title: Chicken and Rice Stew
description: Peel pearl onions and cut into wedges. Peel garlic and chop finely. Remove chicken from the roasting pan and saute onions and garlic in the same pan until translucent. Add rice and saute briefly. Season with salt and pepper and add broth. Rinse bell peppers, halve and remove seeds and ribs, cut into small cubes. Add bell peppers and peas to the pan. Return chicken to the pan, add bay leaf and cook in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 40 minutes. Add more broth to the pan as needed.

title: Risotto with Ham and Snap Peas
description: 45 mins

title: Fried Rice with Chicken and Egg
description: Stir-fry the chicken in hot oil in wok until golden brown, 2-3 minutes, together with the ginger and garlic. Push up on the edge and in the middle cook the onion with the leek for about 5 minutes. Move cooked food up again and cook the rice briefly. Mix all ingredients in the wok with 2 tablespoons chile sauce and 2 tablespoons soy sauce and push to the edge. Beat the eggs with 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Pour in the middle of the wok and bake for an omelette. Divide with the spatula into pieces and mix together all ingredients. Season with lime juice, soy sauce and chile sauce and distribute among bowls. Serve garnished with cilantro leaves.

title: Healthy Chicken Paella
description: The bright yellow paella covers the daily requirement of vitamin B6, which our protein metabolism and nervous system need for their work, with just one portion. The vitamin D content is also impressive - indispensable for skin and bones as well as powerful muscles.

title: Mushroom Risotto with Parmesan
description: The season for porcini mushrooms starts relatively early in August to October, some varieties grow as early as June. In Italy the mushrooms are very popular, so it is no wonder that we find porcini mushrooms in a typical Italian risotto. You can also use a mix of wild mushrooms as a recipe variation. Even though mushrooms are very healthy, we should not eat wild mushrooms more than once a week, as they can be contaminated with heavy metals and radioactive substances.

title: Indian Dosa with Coconut-Potatoes
description: The power lies in waiting: these delicious Indian crêpes (dosas) need time. They compensate for this with plenty of cell-protecting vitamin E and a wealth of important minerals and trace elements.

title: Red Cabbage Risotto with Sausage
description: Trim the cabbage, remove the hard stalk and cut into fine strips.

title: Rhubarb Rice Pudding
description: Toast the almonds in a dry frying pan. Stir the rhubarb puree and up to 1 tablespoon of the almonds into the cooked rice. To serve, scoop the rhubarb rice pudding onto small plates, drizzle with raspberry sauce and sprinkle with almonds. Serve immediately.

title: Stuffed Tomatoes with Peas, Zucchini and Rice
description: Rinse the tomatoes, cut the top off and reserve. Remove the seeds with a spoon.

title: Middle Eastern-Style Rice with Meatballs
description: Heat the oil in a pan and cook meatballs on all sides. Add the rice, shallot and garlic and sweat briefly. Stir in the tomato paste and deglaze with broth. Simmer over medium heat for about 20 minutes. 5 minutes before end of cooking stir in the vegetables. Add the cinnamon, cloves and coriander and season the rice with salt and pepper. Serve.

title: Avocado Rice Salad
description: Bring broth to a boil. Rinse rice and add to boiling broth. Cover and cook at low heat for about 20-25 minutes. Then open and leave to cool.

title: Sushi Boats
description: Salmon supplies omega-3 fatty acids, which ensure that the blood flows well and thus have a positive influence on the cardiovascular system. The fine fish also contains the often scarce trace element iodine.

title: Coconut Rice Pudding with Fruit Salad
description: The mix of coconut milk and rice tastes great and makes you feel full; the fruit salad on top provides a thick portion of vitamins. This rice pudding variant is also ideal for children with lactose intolerance: coconut milk contains no lactose.

title: Rice with Peas and Cheese
description: Milk and cheese provide high-quality protein and plenty of calcium for bones and teeth. Natural rice contains valuable vitamins and minerals, and the peas strengthen the immune system through saponins.

title: Herb Rice Salad with Shrimp
description: Drain and cool the rice. Stir the herbs and lemon dressing into the rice. Allow to stand for 10 minutes. Rinse the shrimp and pat dry. Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the shrimp and cook until pink, about 3 minutes per side. Serve the rice with the shrimp on top.

title: Pumpkin Risotto Casserole
description: Heat carrot juice in a pot. Peel and quarter pumpkin, core and cut into 1/2 cm (approximately 1/5 inch) wide strips. Grease baking dish with olive oil.

title: Moroccan Soup for Ramadan
description: Sauté the spices with 1 teaspoon salt in 1 tablespoon of clarified butter. Add 1 1/4 liters (approximately 6 cups) of water and bring to a boil. Add to meat pot, cover, and gently simmer about 1 hour.

title: Colorful Rice Salad
description: Rinse bell peppers, wipe dry, halve, remove seeds and ribs and cut into narrow strips. Rinse and dry tomato, quarter, remove stem and cut into thin strips. Peel onion, halve and cut into strips. Toast pine nuts in a dry skillet until golden, remove and set aside.

title: Rice and Cucumber Salad with Shrimp

title: Fruit and Vegetable Rice Salad
description: Mix the fruit into the rice and vegetable mixture. Mix together the mayonnaise, sour cream, salt and pepper until smooth, then add to the salad. Season with salt and pepper, cover and let sit for a half hour. Serve with flatbread, as desired.

title: Rice Salad with Ham, Olives and Peppers
description: Cut the ham, salami and cheese into strips. Rinse the parsley, dry and chop finely. Transfer to a bowl along with the peppers and pepperoncini and the rice. Add the oil, season with salt and pepper, fluff with a fork and serve. Garnish with the olives.

title: Rice and Vegetable Soup

title: Asian Coconut-Chicken Soup with Mango and Crispy Noodles
description: Remove the tough outer layers of the lemongrass  and cut the lemongrass into fine rings. Peel the mango, remove the pulp from the pit and cut into bite-size pieces. Rinse and thinly slice the scallions. Rinse the bean sprouts in a colander and drain.

title: Rice with Seafood (Paella)
description: Rinse bell pepper, dry, halve, remove seeds and ribs and dice into cubes. Blanch tomatoes, cool in an ice bath, peel skin, quarter, core and dice into cubes. Peel shallot and garlic and finely chop.

title: Spanish Style Fried Rice (Paella)
description: Peel chorizo ​​and cut into slices. Rinse meat, pat dry and cut into large pieces. Rinse prawns and mussels under cold water and pat dry on paper towels.

title: Chicken Stir-Fry with Coconut Rice
description: Bring coconut milk and rice to a boil. Season with salt and add a pinch of sugar. Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, for about 20 minutes.

title: Stir-Fried Beef with Broccoli and Peppers
description: You can always use chicken instead of beef if you are trying to limit red meat or fat.

title: Spanish Paella
description: In a pan heat oil and quickly fry chicken pieces on all sides. Season with salt and pepper, turn again and remove. Cook pork in same pan, also sear and flavor. Remove from pan and add to chicken. Add mussels and prawns to the pan, season and fry and remove while the shells are still closed. Remove and set aside. Add onion and garlic in the pan, cook until translucent. Add rice and spices and pour in broth. Cook for 20-25 minutes over medium heat.
types: ['Mussel and Clam', 'Paella', 'skillet dish', 'skillet rice dish', 'European', 'Mediterranean', 'Spanish', 'Cooking on vacation', 'Seafood', 'Rice']

title: Pumpkin and Rice Gratin
description: Rinse and grate the pumpkin flesh. Peel the onion and cut into small cubes. Heat the butter in a saucepan, add the onion and pumpkin and sauté briefly. Pour in the broth and cook until the pumpkin is tender, about 7 minutes. Set aside, let cool slightly and mix in the cream cheese. In a bowl, stir together the egg, cheese and rice and stir in the onion-pumpkin mixture. Divide among 4 ramekins and bake until set, about 20 minutes. If browning too quickly, cover with aluminum foil. Remove from the oven, invert onto plates and serve.

title: Pork Vegetable Fried Rice
description: In a large frying pan or in a wok, heat oil and sear meat in portions until brown then remove. Add vegetables and sauté, deglaze with broth, stir in spices and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add meat and reheat, add rice and mix in. Season everything to taste and serve hot.

title: Savoy Cabbage and Mushroom Parcels
description: Rinse cabbage leaves, blanch in salted water for about 1 minute, rinse and drain. Cut the midrib of the cooled cabbage leaves so leaves lay flat. Clean the mushrooms and cut into small cubes. Trim the scallions, rinse and cut into thin rings. Rinse the tomatoes, cut crosswise, dip in boiling water, peel, cut in half, remove seeds and finely chop. Rinse the sprouts with cold water and drain.
types: ['Vegetable', 'diet', 'Healthy Eating', '250-400 Calorie', 'Vegan', 'Vegan Entree for Christmas', 'Vegan Dinner', 'Vegan Entree', 'roulade', 'mushroom', 'Rice']

title: Rice Salad with Papaya and Mushrooms
description: Combine rice with prepared ingredients. Mix vinegar, lemon juice and parsley. Add to rice and mix well. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

title: Rice Noodles with Vegetables
description: Peel the leek and carrots, trim and cut into thin strips, about 4 cm (approximately 1 1/2 inches) long. Peel the ginger and garlic and finely chop. Stir-fry ginger and garlic with peanuts in hot oil in a wok. Add the vegetables, cook 1-2 minutes and deglaze with a little soy sauce and rice wine. Mix in the noodles and cook briefly. Season and serve with soy sauce and pepper.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Peel the shallot and garlic, finely chop and saute in a pan with 2 tablespoons of oil. Add the rice and saute until translucent. Remove the dried mushrooms from water, chop into pieces and add to the rice along with the bay leaf and lemon peel. Deglaze with the wine and stir. Add just enough broth to cover everything. Stir until broth is absorbed, then cover with more broth. Repeat as needed until the rice is fully cooked.

title: Red Wine Risotto with Fresh Strawberries
description: Fold in the grated Parmesan cheese.

title: Creamy Risotto with Sautéed Shrimp
description: Cut the king prawns in half lengthwise and sauté until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, remove from the heat and deglaze with the remaining white wine. Sprinkle with the lemon zest.

title: Risotto with Fennel, Peas, and Shrimp
description: Heat the oil in a saucepan. Sauté the garlic, shallots, and rice for 1-2 minutes, then deglaze with the white wine. Bring to a boil, then add 2 ladles of broth. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly. Cook until the broth is absorbed, then add more broth and repeat the process. Repeat this process until the broth has been used, and the rice is al dente. If the broth is used and the rice isn't cooked enough, you can supplement it with hot water. Season the risotto to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Pear and Leek Salad with Glazed Walnuts and Rice Noodles
description: Allow the sugar to caramelize with the walnuts in a pan , stir briefly and place on parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Let cool and coarsely chop again. In another pan, melt the butter and sauté the pears with the leeks, while swirling, 3-4 minutes. Deglaze with the vinegar and season with salt and pepper.

title: Leek and Fish Rice Paper Rolls
description: Rinse, clean and chop the leeks. Set aside a small amount for garnish. Sauté the sliced leeks in 1-2 tablespoons butter until translucent, 2-3 minutes. Set aside and cool. Rinse the fish, pat dry and cut into small cubes. Mix with the leeks and season with lemon juice, salt and pepper.

title: Red Risotto with Parmesan and Thyme
description: Peel the onion and finely chop. Rinse the tomatoes, remove the stems and cut the flesh into cubes. Rinse the thyme, shake dry and chop the leaves. Drain the sun-dried tomatoes and chop. Grate the Parmesan.

title: Maki Sushi with Pumpkin and Wild Salmon
description: Drain pumpkin and cut into small strips or pieces. Cut salmon fillet into 1 cm (approximately 1/2-inch) thick strips.

title: Cabbage Rolls with Tomato Rice
description: Peel 1 shallot and the garlic cloves, chop finely and cook in a hot pan with 20 grams (approximately 1 1/2 tablespoons) melted butter until translucent, 1-2 minutes. Mix ground meat with egg. Squeeze the milk from the roll, crumble and add to meat along with the onion-garlic mixture. Season with salt, pepper and cumin. Lay 2 cabbage leaves slightly overlapping side-by-side and top with some of the meat mixture. Fold in sides and roll the cabbage leaves around the meat mixture, into a roulade. Secure the rolls with kitchen twine. Sear on all sides in a hot roasting pan with clarified butter. Deglaze pan with 200 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) broth and simmer for 40-45 minutes in the oven.

title: Risotto with Asparagus and Sage
description: Stir in the Parmesan and butter. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Paella with Assorted Meats, Spicy Sausage and Seafood
description: Preheat the oven to 160°C (approximately 325°F) convection.

title: Red Mullet with Rice Noodles
description: Sauté the scallions in hot oil in a wok and pour in the stock. Add the fish and the chili sauce. Cover and let stand about 5-6 minutes. Then remove the fish and add the noodles to the wok. Add soy sauce to taste and toss with ingredients in the wok to combine. Arrange noodles and fish together on warmed plates and serve.

title: Chicken Drumsticks with Saffron Rice
description: Peel garlic cloves and finely chop. Rinse the chicken drumsticks and pat dry. Season well with salt and pepper. Mix chopped garlic with lemon juice, tomato paste, olive oil and a little curry powder. Brush chicken legs with the marinade and place in a greased baking dish with about 150 ml of water. Rinse rosemary, remove leaves and sprinkle over chicken. Bake for about 30 minutes, basting occasionally.

title: Risotto with Saffron
description: Soak saffron threads in 3 tablespoons lukewarm water.

title: Risotto with Kohlrabi and Chervil
description: Pour in enough broth to just cover the rice. Cook at a low boil until broth is absorbed by the rice, stirring frequently. Continue adding broth and cooking until liquid has been absorbed, until rice is al dente. Stir in the rest of the butter, the kohlrabi greens and Parmesan. Mix in the chervil in at the end. Season the risotto with salt and pepper, arrange on warmed plates and serve.

title: Rice with Shrimp and Mussels (Paella)
description: Rinse the bell peppers, trim, remove the seeds and cut into strips.

title: Roast Lamb with Vegetable Rice
description: Peel and dice onion, carrot and celery. Saute in the same pan using remaining oil and lamb drippings. Stir in tomato paste and deglaze with lamb stock. Add bay leaf and thyme and simmer to reduce by about half.

title: Wild Rice with Vegetables and Chicken Breast
description: Cook rice according to package instructions in boiling salted water until al dente. Rinse vegetables, dry and cut into very thin strips about 6-7 cm (approximately 2–2 1/2 inches) long. Rinse herbs, shake dry and chop finely.

title: Asian-Style Rice-Fish Casserole
description: Rinse the rice in a colander and drain.

title: Pork, Broccoli, and Rice Noodle Stir-Fry
description: Cook the rice noodles according to the package directions for al dente. Drain in a colander.

title: Rice Paper Rolls with Shrimp, Vegetables and Dip
description: Remove and peel the lower 1/3 of the asparagus spears and steam spears until al dente, 10-15 minutes. Plunge into ice water to stop cooking and drain.

title: Crispy Rice with Peas and Eggs
description: Cut ham into squares of about 1 cm (approximately 3/8 inch). Peel, rinse and dice the carrots.

title: Salad Rolls
description: Rinse or peel celery, carrots and bell pepper and cut into thin sticks. Rinse lettuce leaves, pat dry and pluck small as needed. Rinse basil and pluck leaves.

title: Vegetable Risotto with Toasted Bread, Pesto and Rosemary
description: Remove pan from heat and stir in Parmesan, butter and parsley. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Spring Rolls with Asparagus and Shrimp
description: Place lettuce leaf, asparagus, and halved cooked shrimp in the center of a rice paper sheet. Season with salt and pepper, drizzle with vinegar and peanut oil. Fold in opposite sides of rice paper sheet and roll the rice paper, making sure that the filling is secured. Roll remaining rolls in the same manner. Slice rolls in half. Serve four cut rolls per plate.

title: Vietnamese Style Spring Rolls
description: Fill a shallow dish (slightly larger than the sheets of rice paper) with water. Spread a towel in front of the plate and keep a second towel handy. Drop sheets one at a time into the water and soak for about 1 minute. Gently spread on the cloth and pat dry with a second cloth. Place clean lettuce in the center of the rice paper and add two lengthwise halved shrimp and some asparagus. Drizzle with a little vinegar. Fold opposite sides to the center and roll the rice paper around the filling. Continue to assemble the rest of the spring rolls in the same way. Cut spring rolls in half. To serve, place four spring roll halves on each plate.

title: Nigiri with Omelet
description: Meanwhile, divide the sushi rice into 12 portions and shape each portion with moistened hands (moistened in vinegar water) into oblong balls.

title: Chicken Seafood Paella
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C / 350°F.

title: Green Risotto with Pesto
description: For the pesto: Rinse the lettuce and spinach and shake dry. Peel the garlic. Saute the pine nuts in a dry skillet until golden brown. Place the lamb's lettuce, spinach, garlic and pine nuts in a blender and finely chop. Add 50 grams (approximately 1 1/2 ounces) grated Parmesan and gradually incorporate the olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
types: ['Risotto', 'Vegetable', 'leafy green vegetable', 'Rice', 'Spinach risotto', 'Pesto', 'Green pesto', 'Pesto with Spinach']

title: Spring Rolls with Pork and Peanuts
description: Rinse, trim and roughly chop the nappa cabbage. Rinse, trim and cut the scallions into strips. Rinse, trim, remove seeds and finely chop the chile. Peel the garlic cloves and chop finely.

title: Spiced Basmati Rice
description: Heat the oil and the butter in a saucepan. Add the chopped ingredients with the saffron while stirring on low to medium heat for 2 minutes. Add the basmati rice and sauté for 1 minute while stirring. Deglaze with the lime juice and the vegetable stock.

title: Nasi Goreng (Indonesian Rice) with Chicken Skewers (Satay)
description: For the Nasi Goreng, place the bean sprouts in a colander and pour boiling water over the top, then drain well. Peel the carrot and cut into strips. Rinse and trim the cabbage and slice into strips. Rinse the rice under running water in a sieve, then bring to a boil with almost twice the amount of lightly salted water. Cover, reduce the heat and simmer for about 25 minutes. Mix together the shrimp paste, soy sauce, ketchup, and rice vinegar. Rinse and halve the chilies lengthwise, remove the seeds, and cut into thin strips. Rinse and trim the scallions and peel the garlic and chop both. Heat the oil in a wok or large pan and sauté the chilies, garlic, and scallions. Add the Chinese cabbage and carrots and cook briefly. Add the rice and the marinade, fry briefly while stirring. Rinse the shrimp in cold water and drain in a colander, then mix with the rice. Whisk the egg with a fork. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a separate pan over low heat. Pour the whisked egg into the pan and cook for 3 minutes, turning once. Roll up the omelette and cut into thin strips and mix with the Nasi Goreng.
types: ['Chicken', 'skillet dish', 'skillet rice dish', 'Asian', 'Indonesian', 'Cooking on vacation', 'Meal for Four', 'Guest', 'weekend cooking', 'Meat', 'Vegetable', 'Shrimp', 'Rice', 'Sauce', 'Lunch', 'Dinner']

title: Red Wine Risotto with Lamb Meatballs
description: For the risotto, peel and finely chop the onion and garlic. Heat the olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a saucepan, then sauté onions and garlic until translucent. Bring broth to a boil in a small pot, then reduce heat and keep warm. Add rice to the skillet with the onions and garlic, and saute while stirring until the rice looks translucent. Add in bay leaf and lemon zest. Pour in half of the wine, and let boil until evaporated. Repeat with the remaining wine, then ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) broth and cook until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Spring Rolls with Raspberry Dipping Sauce
description: Lay the rice paper sheets between moistened sheets of parchment paper.

title: Lemon-Rice Soup
description: Peel and chop onion and parsnips. Heat butter in a pan and sauté onion and parsnips for about 1-2 minutes until onion is translucent. Deglaze pan with broth and simmer for about 15 minutes on low heat. Strain through a sieve into another pot, add rice and heat until warmed through. Remove from heat, stir in remaining lemon juice, lemon zest and cream cheese. Season with salt and sugar to taste. Serve sprinkled with parsley.

title: Stuffed Peppers with Rice and Olive Salsa
description: Oil baking dish.

title: Vietnamese Spring Rolls
description: Fill a shallow dish (slightly larger than the sheets of rice paper) with water. Spread a cloth on work surface and have a second cloth ready. Place one sheet of rice paper at a time in the water and soak 1 minute. Remove and gently spread on the cloth and pat dry with a second cloth.

title: Lemon Risotto with Pine Nuts
description: Add rice and sauté until rice is translucent. Deglaze pan with wine and cook, stirring, until wine is fully absorbed. Add 2 ladles of hot broth and lemon juice and cook rice, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Rosemary Risotto with Lemon and Pine Nuts
description: Remove rosemary and add rice. Sauté until rice is translucent and deglaze pan with wine. Cook until wine is evaporated and add 2 ladles of broth and the lemon juice. Cook, stirring frequently, until almost liquid has absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Nasi Goreng with Pork Strips
description: Peel shallots and garlic and chop finely. Crush shrimp. Rinse and dry scallions, cut white parts into rings, cut green parts into strips. Rinse pork, pat dry and cut into thin strips.

title: Seafood Paella
description: Cut an “X” in the base of the tomatoes, blanch in boiling water, peel, quarter, remove the seeds and chop.

title: Spicy Indian-Style Rice Gratin
description: Grease a baking dish with butter and fill with 1/3 of the rice. Spread with about half of the sauce, top with half of the shrimp and another third of the rice. Repeat the process and finish with the rice. Drizzle with the remaining sauce and sprinkle with the saffron threads. Cover with small pieces of butter and bake until golden in a preheated oven for about 10 minutes. Serve hot.

title: Pork Stir-fry with Peppers, Snow Peas and Rice
description: Heat half of the oil in a wok. Sear the meat on both sides about 2 minutes, remove and keep warm. Add the remaining oil to the wok, add the vegetables and sauté for about 5 minutes while stirring. Mix in the meat, reheat everything and season with soy sauce, salt and pepper. Serve with rice.

title: Dill and Lemon Risotto with Smoked Salmon
description: Cook risotto over medium heat, stirring constantly. Add a little chicken broth, let soak into rice and add a little more broth while stirring constantly. Continue until rice is creamy and has a light bite (approximately 20 minutes).

title: Grilled Chicken Skewers with Rice and Vegetables
description: Cook rice according to package instructions.

title: Stuffed Artichokes with Rice and Peppers
description: Cook rice in boiling salted water according to the package instructions until al dente.

title: Risotto with Ham
description: Stir in cream, grated Parmesan, lemon juice and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with sliced ham and shaved Parmesan.

title: Risotto with Mushrooms
description: Ceps in 300 ml of hot water and soak for about 10 minutes. Rinse mushrooms and cut into slices. Peel onion and chop finely.

title: Broccoli with Almonds and Rice Balls
description: Rinse broccoli, cut off florets and blanch in boiling salted water for about 6 minutes. Lightly toast sliced almonds in a dry skillet. Drain broccoli and combine with vinegar and almonds. Shape sticky rice into balls, place broccoli and rice balls on plates and serve.

title: Pumpkin and Walnut Risotto
description: Heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter in a saucepan. Saute onion and garlic until soft and add pumpkin and rice. Saute together, stirring frequently, until rice looks translucent. Add half of the wine and cook until wine is evaporated.

title: Fennel Risotto with Radicchio
description: Deglaze pan with wine and cook rice, stirring, until wine is fully absorbed. Add broth so that rice is just covered and cook, stirring, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Cranberry Risotto
description: Boil cranberries with sugar and a little water. Remove from heat and let rest.

title: Fava Bean Risotto
description: Add rice to onion and sauté with 125 ml (approximately 1/2 cup) wine, deglaze, reduce, add more wine and let mixture boil. Pour in broth until rice is just covered and simmer gently, stirring occasionally. Add bay leaf and let simmer. Gradually pour in remaining broth and cook for a total of about 15-20 minutes. Risotto should have a creamy consistency but rice should still have bite.

title: Lemony Risotto with Grilled King Prawns
description: For the lemony risotto, heat 3 tablespoons oil in a saucepan and saute the onion, garlic and lemon zest over medium heat. Add in the rice, saute briefly and then pour in the wine. Bring to a boil, pour in the chicken broth and lemon juice and cook while stirring over medium heat. Add a little broth at intervals until thr risotto is cooked (al dente). Season with salt and pepper.

title: Risotto with Jerusalem Artichoke
description: Peel and finely chop onion. Heat 1-2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and sauté onion until translucent. Add rice and diced Jerusalem artichoke and cook, stirring, until rice is translucent. Add wine and cook, stirring, until wine is fully absorbed. Add hot broth and cook rice, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Chicken Pilaf with Raisins and Noodles
description: Cook the noodles in a pot of boiling salted water according to package directions. Drain well.
types: ['leafy green vegetable', 'Tropical Fruit', 'Rice', 'Dinner', 'Menu', 'Gourmet', 'Healthy Eating', 'Asian', 'Uzbek', 'Chicken Noodle Soup']

title: Risotto with Peppers and Goat Cheese
description: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a saucepan.  Saute peppers, onion, garlic on low to medium heat for 2-3 minutes, stirring. Add rice and sauté until rice is translucent. Add lemon juice and half of vegetable stock. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 5-7 minutes on low heat until almost all liquid is absorbed.Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 5-7 minutes, stirring frequently. Season bell pepper risotto with salt and pepper and keep warm. Heat remaining oil (2 tablespoons) in a pan. Thread goat cheese slices horizontally on wooden skerwers. Saute cheese slices on medium to high heat, turning once, until cheese is lightly browned. Arrange bell pepper risotto on plates, top with goat cheese skewers. Garnish with lemon zest strips, pepperoncini rings and basil leaves. Serve.

title: Rice Pudding with Cherries
description: Rinse, drain and pit cherries.

title: Risotto with Green Asparagus Tips
description: Peel and thinly slice the remaining garlic. Heat the remaining oil and add the garlic. Cook until golden. Blanch the asparagus tips in boiling salted water until al dente, about 5 minutes. Stir in the thyme, cheese, saffron and butter into the rice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. To serve, divide the risotto between plates and garnish with the fried garlic slices.

title: Cherry Rice Pudding
description: Pour cherries through a sieve and leave to drain.

title: Italian Rice Balls
description: For breading, whisk together the remaining eggs in a deep dish or similar container, season with salt and pepper. Cut the cheese into small cubes.

title: Rice Pudding with Saffron and Strawberry Compote
description: Place the rice with milk, butter, lemon zest and saffron threads in a pot and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Then turn off the heat, cover and let the rice sit for about 25 minutes. Season with about 50 grams (approximately 2 ounces) of sugar.

title: Rice Pudding with Strawberry Sauce
description: Rinse, trim and chop mixed berries as needed. Rinse apricots, cut in half, remove seeds and dice finely. Mix berries with vanilla flavor.

title: Rice Cake with Orange Zest
description: Separate the eggs. Put yolks, sugar, lemon zest and juice in a bowl. Beat everything creamy with the whisk of an electric hand mixer and stir in the rice. Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold in. Pour into a buttered baking dish or tart pan. Bake in a preheated oven (180°C , approximately 350°F) for 45 minutes.

title: Meaty Rice with Herbs
description: Rinse the herbs, shake dry, pluck off the leaves and chop finely. Rinse the chives and cut diagonally into rolls. In a pan, heat the oil and fry the ground meat until crumbly. Add shallot and vegetables and sauté briefly.

title: Asian Soup with Rice Noodles
description: Peel garlic and ginger and cut into thin slices. Rinse lemongrass, trim and cut into pieces. Rinse mint, shake dry and pluck leaves. Reserve some mint leaves for garnish.

title: Nasi Goreng with Mixed Vegetables and Fried Egg
description: Peel mango--the pulp, without cutting the core--and cut into small cubes. Trim garlic, chop finely and cook in a pan with hot oil glassy. Sauté with vegetables briefly. Add mango cubes to cooked rice, mix and flavor everything with soy sauce, sambal oelek.

title: Beef and Rice Noodle Salad
description: Cook the pasta in a pot of boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Fried Mozzarella Rice Balls
description: Mix the egg and thyme into the risotto and let cool completely.

title: Pilaf with Vegetables, Almonds, and Chiles
description: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a pan and stir-fry the almonds for 1–2 minutes. Add carrots and zucchini and continue to sauté. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper.

title: Paella with Vegetables, Ham and Basil
description: Rinse the bell peppers, cut into quarters, and remove the seeds and ribs. Rinse the zucchini and tomatoes and pat dry. Cut the vegetables into bite-sized pieces. Peel the onions and garlic and chop finely. Cut the ham into slightly larger cubes.

title: Flemish Style Rice Casserole Dessert
description: Rinse fresh lemon in hot water, wipe dry and grate zest. Finely chop half of zest. Separate eggs. Combine egg whites with salt and lemon juice, beat until stiff. Beat egg yolks with butter and sugar until fluffy. Combine yolks and chopped lemon zest with rice. Fold in egg whites. Pour mixture into a buttered baking dish and bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 40-50 minutes. Take out of the oven, cool slightly and serve sprinkle with powered sugar and garnished with remaining lemon zest.

title: Rice Pudding with Raspberry Sauce
description: For the sauce, sort raspberries and bring to a boil in a saucepan with the lemon juice, sugar and 3-4 tablespoons of water. Strain through a sieve and let cool.

title: Rice Noodle Soup with Pancetta and Bok Choy
description: Meanwhile, separate the leaves from the bok choy. Rinse the bok choy leaves, shake dry and slice into strips. Rinse the bok choy stems and leave whole or cut into large pieces. Rinse the radishes and slice. Peel the eggs. Rinse the lemongrass, pat dry and finely chop. Rinse the scallions and slice into long narrow strips.

title: Sweet Risotto with Strawberries
description: Let the rice pudding cool slightly, mix in the strawberry cubes and strawberry syrup and place in small bowl. Serve lukewarm, garnished with the strawberry slices.

title: Coconut-Lime Rice Pudding
description: Add the rice to the milk and bring to a boil while stirring, then turn the heat down to the very lowest setting.

title: Rice Pudding with Oranges
description: Separate eggs. Whisk egg yolks with reserved milk and add to still hot rice. Allow to cool, stirring occasionally. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into cooled rice. Place pudding into four bowls and refrigerate for about 1 hour.

title: Coconut Chicken Soup with Rice Noodles and Vegetables
description: Rinse bell peppers, halve, remove seeds and ribs. Rinse, dry and cut scallions into 3-4 cm (approximately 1-1,5 inches) long pieces. Rinse soybean sprouts and bamboo shoots.

title: Swordfish and Shrimp Risotto
description: Zest the lemon and squeeze the juice. Rinse the zucchini, cut in half lengthwise and slice. Rinse the fish and cut into cubes. Add to the risotto along with the lemon zest and zucchini during the last 5 minutes of cooking time.

title: Risotto Topped with Sushi, Egg and Caviar
description: Peel the papaya, remove the seeds and dice the flesh finely. Pick the crabmeat apart and mix with the papaya. Season with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Rinse the bass, pat dry, place between 2 layers of plastic wrap and gently flatten. Cut into 4 slices and  divdie the crabmeat salad among the slices. Roll up.

title: Sweet and Sour Stuffed Calamari with Peppers
description: Rinse bell peppers, halve and remove seeds and ribs, peel with a peeler. Cut into small pieces. Peel onion and chop finely. Heat  1-2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and saute peppers and onion for 1-2 minutes. Sprinkle with sugar and add rice vinegar. Add a little water, cover and simmer for about 15 minutes on low heat. Season with salt and drizzle with lemon juice.

title: Rice and Vegetable Soup
description: Season with salt and pepper, then deglaze with sherry. Pour in the stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and stir in the rice and mushrooms. Gently heat for 5 minutes. Season again to taste. Garnish with watercress to serve.

title: Rice Pudding with Honey Figs
description: Rinse and quarter the figs. Stir together the honey and lemon juice. Toss with the figs and let sit for 20 minutes.

title: Frozen Rice Parfait with Orange Sauce
description: Meanwhile, bring 250 grams (approximately 1 cup) water and 60 grams (approximately 1/4 cup) sugar to a boil and cook until syrupy. Let cool.

title: Lamb and Lentil Stew
description: Rinse meat, pat dry, cut into small cubes.

title: Spicy Tuna with Nori on Sushi Rice
description: Add 300ml (approximately 1.25 cups) of water and a small piece of kombu in a solid cooking container and cook at 100°C (approximately 210°F) for 18 minutes in the electric steamer, stirring occasionally.

title: Greek Style Sandwich with Souvlaki and Vegetable Rice
description: Rinse tomatoes, quarter and remove stems, cut into narrow strips. Peel and halve onions, cut into fine strips. Rinse and dry peppers, halve, remove seeds and ribs, cut into 0.5cm (approximately 1/4  inch) cubes. Peel cucumber, halve, scoop out seeds and cut into 0.5 cm (approximately 1/4  inch) cubes.

title: Rice Paper Rolls with Duck Meat
description: Meanwhile, soak rice paper sheets between damp cloths. Peel the avocado, cut in half, remove the pit and cut the flesh into thin slices. Rinse lettuce leaves and spin dry. Peel and slice onion. Place lettuce in the middle of one rice paper sheet. Add duck strips, avocado and onion. Sprinkle with peanuts. Fold in the two opposite sides of the rice paper sheet roll the rest around the filling. Continue making rolls in this way with all the sheets of rice paper.

title: Rice Paper Rolls With Raw Vegetables
description: Rinse vegetables, trim, peel and cut into 8-10 cm (approximately 3 inch) long sticks. Cut sheets of rice paper in half. Form mixed vegetables into small bundles and secure with chives or scallion green. Roll in the rice paper. Serve spring rolls with soy sauce or other savory sauce to taste.

title: Grilled Lamb with Vegetable Rice
description: Rinse rice and lentils and combine with vegetable stock. Bring to a boil and simmer, covered, for about 25 minutes. Add more broth as needed.

title: Braised Beef Shanks with Saffron Risotto
description: Meantime, rinse carrots, celery and leeks. Peel and cut into small cubes. Rinse sage and thyme, shake dry, tie a bouquet. Add vegetables as well as sage, thyme, and bay leaf to beef about 30-40 minutes before the end of cooking.

title: Rice with Sausages
description: Peel onion and chop. Rinse tomatoes, halve, scrape out seeds with a spoon and pulp tomato halves with a hand blender. Heat oil in a saucepan and fry sausages for 3 minutes then lift out. In remaining grease fry chopped onion at low to medium heat for 2 minutes until translucent. Add rice and tomato paste and sauté, stirring, for under 1 minute. Mix rice with mashed tomatoes and deglaze with broth. Season with salt and pepper. Cook rice, covered, stirring frequently, until rice absorbs liquid, about 12 minutes.

title: Seafood Paella
description: Heat oil in a large pan (paella pan), sauté onion with garlic until translucent. Add squid and Sepiola and briefly sear. Add leeks and 2/3 of tomatoes to the pan and cook for 5 minutes while stirring. Add rice, stir and fry for a few minutes until rice grains shine and look slightly glazed. Add wine, fish stock and saffron water and season with salt, pepper, bay leaf, paprika and curry. Cook for about 10 minutes.

title: Mixed Beans and Rice with Chicken Skewers and Mango

title: Asian Rice with Vegetables
description: Peel the garlic and chop finely. Rinse the scallions, halve and cut lengthwise into strips. Rinse, seed and also cut lengthwise into strips the cucumber.

title: Vegetable Rice with Chicken
description: Cut the chicken into thin slices or strips. Thaw the brocolli in a strainer. Drain the corn. Rinse the tomatoes, pat dry and cut into quarters. Peel the onion, ginger and garlic and chop everything finely. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a pan or wok and sear the chicken, then remove from pan, then in the same pan add and sauté the broccoli and onion mixture and stir continuously for 2-3 minutes. Add the remaining vegetables, cook another 2 minutes, mix the rice in, add the chicken and oyster sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes while stirring continuously.

title: Porcini Mushroom Risotto
description: Peel the onion and garlic, finely chop the onion and sauté with the garlic in a pan with oil until golden brown. Add the rice and mushrooms, sauté briefly and deglaze with the wine. Cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Add the mushroom soaking water and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Gradually add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in cheese and thyme and cook until cheese melts. Season the risotto with salt and pepper and serve in bowls.

title: Risotto with Fennel
description: Rinse fennel, remove stalk and quarter. Place greens aside for garnish. Cut fennel into strips. Peel shallot and finely chop. Sauté together with fennel in hot oil until translucent. Sauté rice and pour in wine. Gradually pour in some broth, stirring constantly, and let rice soak until risotto is creamy but rice still has a bit of bite (about 20 minutes).

title: Tuna Sushi with Scallions
description: Add with 150 ml (approximately 2/3 cup) of water and a small piece of seawood in a solid steamer insert in an electric steamer and cook at 100°C (approximately 225°F) for 18 minutes, stirring occasionally.

title: Rice and Pea Soup with Pork Meatballs
description: Heat the oil in a skillet, peel the garlic, finely chop and saute until tender. Remove from the heat and allow to cool in the oil. Then pour the oil through a fine sieve. Place the ground tmeat in a bowl, knead with the egg and season with soy sauce, salt and pepper. Shape into small balls each about 2-3 cm (3/4 - 1 1/4-inch) in diameter.  Pour the chicken stock into a saucepan with a little pepper and fish sauce and bring to a simmer. Add the meatballs and peas and simmer over low heat for 5 minutes. Add the rice and let simmer for 1 more minute. Pour the soup into plates, sprinkle with garlic oil and serve sprinkled with dill.

title: Avocado and Rice Salad
description: Combine 150 grams (approximately 5 ounces) of yogurt with 2 tablespoons of oil and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, season with salt and pepper. Peel and press garlic through garlic press. Add garlic to yogurt, combine with rice. Mix avocado cubes with coarsely chopped herbs. Combine avocado and rice salad, sprinkle with red pepper and serve immediately.

title: Thai Rice Rolls with Sweet and Sour Chili Sauce Dip
description: Fill a shallow dish, slightly larger than the sheets of rice paper, with water. In addition, spread a cloth on a work surface and place a second cloth nearby. Dive one rice paper in the dish and soak for about 1 minute. Then gently spread rice paper on the first cloth and pat dry with the second cloth.

title: Wild Rice with Spinach, Feta and Walnuts
description: Rinse the spinach, trim and spin dry. Peel the onion and garlic and chop finely.

title: Mango Rolls with Smoked Trout
description: Top lower third of each dough sheet with lettuce, mango, trout and carrots. Turn in edges and roll. Cut each in half and serve with chili sauce or soy sauce for dipping.

title: Risotto with Ham and Green Beans
description: Add wine and cook, stirring, until all wine is absorbed. Add hot broth until rice is just covered and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Chicken with Lime and Mint on Rce Noodles
description: In a bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil and lime juice. Add the noodles, carrots and zucchini strips and the mint leaves and toss well. Place the noodles on a platter.  Cut chicken crosswise into wide strips, arrange on the pasta, sprinkle with reserved marinade. Sprinkle with diced peppers and serve garnished with lime zest.

title: Risotto Milanese with Clams
description: For the risotto, peel the onion and finely chop. Melt the butter in a saucepan and sauté onions, stirring occasionally. Pour all of the rice in at once and stir. Stir constantly until the rice is translucent. (Neither the onions nor the rice should have color!) Deglaze with some wine. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until the rice has absorbed the liquid. Stir in saffron threads. Pour in stock or wine, stirring constantly. Only when the liquid is mostly absorbed, pour in more stock or wine. Continue process until risotto is done, about 15 minutes, stirring constantly and season to taste.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Heat the oil in a saucepan. Press the garlic through a garlic press. Peel and finely chop the shallots. Saute the garlic, shallots,  bay leaf and porcini powder until the shallots are translucent. Add the rice, stirring to coat, then pour in the wine and let it boil until absorbed.

title: Rice-Stuffed Chinese Cabbage over Beets
description: Cook the rinsed rice with almost twice the amount of water and 1/2 teaspoon salt about 15 minutes until al dente. Remove and separate the leaves of the Napa cabbage. Set aside 5-6 of the largest leaves and cut the smaller inner leaves into thin strips. Rinse the radicchio, cut into quarters, remove the stalk and also cut into strips. Melt the butter in a saucepan and  sauté the Napa cabbage strips, bean sprouts and radicchio 4-5 minutes, then season to taste with soy sauce, salt and pepper. Remove from the heat and add the rice (drained, if necessary).

title: Risotto with Fried Wolffish and Tarragon
description: This will take approximately 20-25 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the butter, tarragon and parsley. Generously season with salt and pepper.

title: Risotto Appetizers
description: Simmer, stirring occasionally until the liquid is almost all absorbed, then add more broth and stir again. Continue until the rice is ready cooked al dente (about 20-25 minutes). Stir in the peas 3 minutes before the end of cooking.

title: Ossobuco with Gremolata Sauce
description: Rinse the meat, pat dry and remove the tendons. Season the meat with salt and pepper, and dust with flour.

title: Rice and Vegetable Salad with Arugula
description: In the meantime, for the vegetables, peel the carrots and summer squash and cut into julienne strips. Rinse the herbs and pluck leaves. Drain tomatoes, collecting the oil and cut tomatoes into thin strips. Heat the oil with 1-2 teaspoons of tomato oil in a pan and fry the vegetables with the herbs while stirring, 2-4 minutes. Add the vinegar, mix well and season with salt and pepper. For the salad, rinse the arugula, trim, shake dry and arrange on plates. Drizzle with vinegar and oil. Stir the rice and place in the center of each plate. Arrange the vegetables around the rice. Serve garnished with thyme.

title: Green Asparagus Risotto with Morels
description: Rinse asparagus, peel only the lower third, trim ends and cut into bite-size pieces.

title: Lamb Chops with Blackberry Sauce and Saffron Rice
description: For the lamb: Preheat the oven to 220°C (approximately 430°F). Season the lamb with salt and pepper and place on a rack set on a baking sheet and bake about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven, tent with aluminum foil and let stand 10 minutes.

title: Saffron Rice with Vegetables
description: Cook rice acording to package instructions, adding saffron in the beginning.

title: Risotto with Mussels
description: Meanwhile, bring a little salted water to a boil in a saucepan. Add the mussels, cover and steam until the mussel open. In a pot of boiling water, blanch the tomatoes for 10 seconds. Peel, halve, remove seeds and cut the tomatoes into cubes. Peel the onion and cut into small cubes. In a pot, heat 2 tablespoons butter and cook the onion until translucent. Add the tomato, salt lightly and cook a few minutes. Fold the tomato mixture, Parmesan cheese and the mussels into the risotto. spoon into bowls and serve garnished with marjoram.

title: Rondini (Round Zucchini) Stuffed with Rice and Pancetta
description: Rinse the rondini, remove the top to create a lid and scoop out the seeds and pulp. Cut the pulp into small cubes. Add to the rice 5 minutes before the end of cooking. Remove the bay leaf.

title: Rice and Pepper Salad with Mozzarella
description: Rinse peppers, halve, remove seeds and ribs and chop roughly. Place on a tray lined with baking paper and sprinkle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper, and roast under broiler for about 4 minutes, watching carefully.

title: Shrimp and Rice Salad with Grapefruit
description: Cook the rice according to package label in plenty of salted water, drain, and cool.

title: Serbian Style Pork and Rice
description: Peel shallot and chop finely. Heat butter in a pan and saute. Add rice and remaining broth. Lower heat and cook, covered, for about 20 minutes. Rice is ready when it has absorbed all liquid. Mix rice with meat and vegetables. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Indian Yellow Dal with Raisin Rice
description: For the rice, boil the broth with the rinsed raisins and a pinch of cinnamon, add the rice, cover and cook until tender, about 25 minutes.

title: Risotto with Gorgonzola and Walnuts
description: Cook rice, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, for about 30 minutes and cooking liquid is almost all absorbed.

title: Green Asparagus Rice Paper Rolls
description: For the vinaigrette: Rinse lime in hot water, wipe dry and finely grate zest. Squeeze juice from lime. In a bowl, whisk the lime zest, lime juice, olive oil and water together until thoroughly combined. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Mushrooms with Rice
description: Heat the peanut oil in a wok. Stir in the cold rice for about 3 minutes. Season with soy sauce and pepper. Add the scallions and drained mushrooms. Saute for another 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Serve immediately.

title: Spanish Rice Dish (paella)
description: Add the peppers, peas, tomatoes, peeled shrimp, squid, chorizo ​​and mussels. Preheat the oven to 200°C (approximately 400°F) and slide in the paella covered with alumnium foil. Cook about 20 minutes.

title: Chinese-style Rice
description: Put the rice in 600 ml (approximately 2.5 cups) of hot water with a pinch of salt and cook al dente. Drain well and cool. Peel and finely chop the onion and garlic. Finely chop the whites of the scallions and cut the greens into strips of about 5 cm (approximately 2 inches) in length. Drain the bamboo shoots.

title: Tomato Risotto
description: Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot broth and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Stir in the tomato paste. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Duck with Curry Sauce and Vegetables
description: Rinse the duck breast fillets under cold, pat dry and saute on the skin side in a dry pan over medium heat until golden brown. Season with salt and pepper, turn, and cook 1 minute on the other side.

title: Beef Ragout over Rice Noodles
description: Heat the oil in a wok and brown the meat on all sides. Add the shallots and cook briefly. Stir in the tomatoes and the black bean sauce and toss with the meat. Add the spices, pour in the broth and simmer 50-60 minutes over medium heat.

title: Fried Rice with Eggs and Vegetables
description: Bring 600 ml (approximately 2 1/2 cups) of salted water and the rice to a boil. Lower the heat and cook for about 20 minutes.

title: Risotto with Fennel
description: Add the white wine and cook, stirring, until evaporated. Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot broth and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Mussels on Risotto
description: For the mussels: Sort the shells. Throw away any opened mussels and brush closed mussels under running water and deburr. Cook remaining shallot mixture in another pot of hot oil until translucent, add mussels and pour in stock and wine. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes over medium heat.

title: Sweet Coconut Rice with Vegetables and Ginger
description: Pour the rice into the simmering milk, stir and cook 5 minutes. Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake the rice in the oven about 20 minutes.. Then allow to cool to room temperature.

title: Sweet Sushi with Kiwi and Rhubarb
description: and simmer over low heat for 15-20 minutes. Cover with a kitchen towel and let stand about 25-30 minutes until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Allow the rice to cool in the refrigerator for 40 minutes.

description: Rinse lemon and orange in hot water and dry. Peel orange and lemon and squeeze juice from both fruit.

title: Curry Rice with Walnuts
description: Meanwhile. peel mango, pit and cut mango pulp into cubes. Drizzle with lemon juice.

title: Fried Rice with Fish, Snow Peas and Peppers
description: Peel onion and garlic and dice. Saute onion and garlic in a pan with 1 tablespoon oil. Add rice and cook briefly. Add broth and saffron, bring to a boil then let soak for about 25 minutes.

title: Paella with Chicken
description: Cut the peppers into quarters, remove the cores, seeds and pith. Rinse and peel the zucchini. Cut the peppers and zucchini into pieces. Rinse and mince the pepperoncini.

title: Salmon Risotto with Edible Flowers
description: For the salmon: Rinse the salmon, pat dry and cut into bite-size pieces. Sprinkle with lemon juice and season lightly with salt and pepper.

title: Wild Rice Salad
description: Cook the rice in boiling salted water for about 40 minutes. Drain and let cool.

title: Duck Curry with Okra and Asian Noodles
description: Slice duck breast into 1 cm (approximately 1/2 in) thick slices. Peel onion and finely chop. Rinse okra and slice. In a pan, heat a little oil, sauté the onion, duck meat, bean sprouts and okra. Stir in the curry, add wine and reduce slightly. Pour in some water, briefly simmer, then season with salt, pepper and chile.

title: Paella with Mussels
description: Simmer 25 minutes. Rinse peppers, cut in half, remove seeds, and white ribs and cut into crosswise into strips. Add to the pan and saute 5 minutes. Serve the mussels on the rice and garnish with oregano.

title: Oriental Rice Pudding
description: Bring milk with a pinch of salt to a boil, add rice, stir in saffron and cook, covered, on lowest heat for about 25 minutes. Simmer until rice is tender and all liquid is almost absorbed. Add rose water and raisins, pour into serving bowls, sprinkle with cinnamon and serve hot or cold.

title: Asian Chicken Soup
description: Rinse, halve, remove the seeds and ribs, and chop the chile peppers. Rinse and slice the celery. Add 4 tablespoons of soy sauce and ginger to the broth. Add the prepared vegetables and chicken. Heat over medium heat for 12-15 minutes. Rinse and chop the spinach.

title: Saffron Rice with Vegetables and Shrimp
description: Rinse snow peas, scallions, carrots and bell peppers and cut into strips. Scrub mushrooms and cut in half, depending on size. Add carrots to rice mixture, add more broth if necessary and simmer about 10 more minutes. Add snow peas, scallions, bell peppers and mushrooms to rice mixture, season with salt and pepper and simmer about 10 more minutes.

title: Layered Dessert with Rice and Fruit
description: Place one tablespoon of rice into four glasses, top with some mango slices. Next layer 2 tablespoons of rice and some melon slices. Again layer 2 tablespoons of rice and some strawberry slices. Repeat layers until all fruit slices are used and rice becomes top layer. Sprinkle with diced fruit.

title: Chicken and Vegetables with Rice
description: Rinse the chicken legs, pat dry, then rub with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven and saute the chicken over medium heat until browned on all sides, about 15 minutes.

title: Rice with Ginger
description: Portion the basmati rice and season to taste with a mixture of lemon zest and dried ginger.

title: Mulligatawny Soup
description: Combine rice and 1 1/2 times the amount of lightly salted water in a pot. Cover and simmer over very low heat, about 25 minutes.

title: Rice with Carrots and Cheese
description: Peel carrots and plane into thin slices. Blanch in salted water for 3 minutes. Cut the Gorgonzola into small cubes.

title: Rice Zucchini Cake
description: Beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper. Mix rice with zucchini, arugula, and onion. Fold the eggs, flour, and Parmesan into the rice mixture. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Asparagus Rice Paper Rolls
description: 25 mins

title: Vegetable Rice with Pork Loin
description: Cut pork loin into slices, season with salt and pepper, and sauté  in hot oil on both sides. Remove the pork and sauté all the chopped peppers in the same pot. Add tomato paste and rice to the pot, sauté, and deglaze with broth. Add raisins, paprika, and chili sauce. Cover and simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes. Then add meat back in and simmer another 10–15 minutes. Season with salt and serve.

title: Stuffed Grape Leaves
description: Spread out the grape leaves on a work surface, cut off stems, and add 1 teaspoon rice mixture to a side of each leaf. Fold over halfway, towards the peak of the leaf, fold up the sides, and roll up tightly. Lay the rolls seam side down into a pot with a wide bottom. Pour lemon juice and 2 tablespoons oil over them. Cover with an inverted plate and pour in enough hot water to cover the rolls. Simmer for about 1 hour over low heat, then let cool 1 hour in the pot.

title: Rice Pudding with Cherries
description: To serve, arrange the rice pudding in serving dishes, top with sour cherries and pine nuts and garnish with mint leaves.

title: Rice Porridge with Apples
description: Meanwhile, rinse, peel and coarsely grate apples. Five minutes before the end of the cooking time, stir in apples and cook until softened. Served porridge hot or cold.

title: Leeks with Rice and Sausage
description: Heat a wok and add oil. Stir-fry the almonds, leeks,

title: Rice Salad with Chicken
description: Meanwhile, simmer chicken with the bay leaf in remaining broth over low heat for 20–25 minutes, covered. Allow to cool slightly. Lift out the meat, remove and discard skin and bones, and cut into small pieces. Rinse scallions and cut into thin rings. Rinse and slice celery. Peel and coarsely grate the carrot.

title: Rice Pilaf with Chicken Breast
description: Blanch tomatoes in boiling water and peel them. Dice into small cubes.

title: Risi E Bisi
description: Add the remaining butter, half the Parmesan and the chopped parsley, and stir to combine.

title: Rice Pudding with Red Fruit Jelly
description: Mix the rice together with the milk, cream, the remaining vanilla sugar, lemon zest and salt in an ovenproof pot. Bring to a boil and cook the rice, let soak and cover over low heat for about 10 minutes. Then place rice in the oven covered for 30-40 minutes at 120°C (approximately 250°F). Mix the rice pudding with maple syrup and cinnamon, transfer to plates and add the fruit jelly. Serve warm or cold garnished with mint.

title: Rice Pudding with Apples
description: Peel, quarter and core 2 of the apples. Slice thinly. Toss apples with lemon juice, 1 tablespoon sugar and cinnamon. Let stand.

title: Rice Asparagus Bake
description: In a large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of oil and sauté the onion until soft. Add the asparagus and sauté briefly.

title: Leek Rice Salad with Tomato and Mint
description: Rinse, dry and cut leeks into rings. Rinse, dry and halve tomatoes. Pluck mint leaves and chop coarsely.

title: Rice Noodles with Tofu, Shrimp and Chicken
description: Cut the tofu into cubes.

title: Spring Rolls
description: Season rice with fish sauce. Place rice, carrots, shrimp and pineapple in the middle of the lettuce leaf in a row. Fold in two opposite sides of the rice paper and roll up tightly. To serve, cut rolls in half with desired dipping sauce.

title: Zucchini Risotto
description: Meanwhile, rinse zucchini, dry and cut into 1-2 cm (approximately 0,5-1 inches) pieces. Combine peas and zucchini pieces, add to rice and cook together for about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add remaining butter and half of parmesan, stir. Remove bay leaf, place risotto in bowls and serve sprinkled with remaining parmesan.

title: Fried Rice with Sea Bream
description: Cut fish into bite-sized pieces, season with salt and pepper and sear on all sides in a pan with vegetable oil. Spoon rice into bowls, top with fish and before serving, sprinkle with sesame seeds.

title: Spinach Risotto with Lemongrass
description: Melt butter in a saucepan, add and sauté leeks and bay leaf. Cut lemongrass stalks in half and add with ginger and rice into the pot. Sauté and add about 1/4 of hot broth, stir and simmer until almost all the liquid is absorbed, then pour in more broth and continue this process until the rice is almost tender. Add spinach and simmer a few minutes. Season with salt, stir in Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

title: Pumpkin Risotto
description: Continue to add broth and stir until rice is creamy and all broth has been used, about 20-25 minutes. Add pumpkin when 10 minutes of cooking the time remains.

title: Scallops with Rice Noodles
description: Rinse the scallions, cut into rings and fry briefly, with the pressed garlic, in 1 tablespoon hot oil. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Asparagus Risotto
description: Peel shallots and finely dice. In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon butter until it becomes foamy, then sauté the asparagus pieces (not tips), shallots and rice. Mix champagne, asparagus stock and broth. Add 2 ladles of water to the rice and let it boil over medium heat while stirring.

title: Asparagus Rice Cakes
description: Boil rice with lightly salted milk and let swell, covered, over low heat for about 20 minutes. Pour rice into a sieve, drain, leave to cool, then transfer contents to a bowl. In a pan heat oil and fry scallions for a few minutes, then stir marjoram, eggs and Pecorino into rice and season with salt and pepper. Grease a round-shaped baking dish (about 20 cm diameter) with oil, fill with rice pudding, smooth out and put more at edges of dish.
