title: Seafood Rice with Pineapple
description: Add mushrooms and clams. Season with salt, pepper and curry. Add pineapple and cook. In a separate pan, sear shrimp in oil on both sides. Fill hollowed-out pineapple with pineapple rice, top with shrimp and garnish with parsley leaves.

title: Peppers Stuffed with Rice, Chicken and Chorizo
description: Heat oil in a saucepan and cook celery for about 2 - 3 minutes. Add paprika, thyme, oregano and rice, mix well, add broth and simmer for 10 minutes on low heat. Add tomatoes and simmer for 10 more minutes.

title: Shrimp with Rice Salad
description: For the sauce: Rinse the chile pepper, halve lengthwise, remove the seeds and white ribs and cut into fine strips. Rinse the pandan leaves and mint, coarsely chop and place in a mortar with the chile and chile sauce and crush while gradually adding the peanut oil. Add the onion, crush slightly and season  with salt and pepper.

title: Cold Rice Pudding with Ham and Peas
description: To make sauce: Melt butter in a saucepan. Add flour and sauté briefly. Deglaze with 400 ml (approximately 1 3/4 cups) broth and cream. Stirring constantly, cook over medium heat about 5 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Stir in remaining peas.

title: Vegetarian Spring Rolls
description: Heat soybean oil in the wok. Add scallions, garlic, chile pepper, bell peppers and lemon zest and cook for about 2 minutes. Stir-fry, then add cabbage strips and contiinue to cook briefly. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Vegetable Rice
description: In the meantime, rinse the leek and cut into rings.

title: Paella with Chicken
description: Rinse chicken legs, pat dry, trim and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a paella pan or large ovenproof skillet and fry chicken on all sides. Bake in a preheated oven 190°C (approximately 400°F) for about 10 minutes.

title: Leek Risotto with Mascarpone
description: Add the rice and cook, stirring until glassy and well coated. Add the wine and cook, stirring occasionally until the rice has absorbed the wine. Season with salt and pepper. Add enough broth to cover the rice by an inch. Cook, stirring frequently for 15 minutes, add the leeks and continue cooking adding more broth as one amount has been absorbed until the rice is creamy with a slight bite, about 15 minutes longer.

title: Spanish Paella Rice with Mussels and Shrimp
description: Heat 5 tablespoons olive oil in a large, deep frying pan and fry the onion in it until soft. Add the pressed garlic and saute briefly. Pour in 0.5 liter (approximately 2½ cups) of beef broth and simmer for 10 minutes.

title: Fruity Rice Salad with Pesto
description: Toast the walnuts in a dry skillet over low heat until crisp and fragrant. Remove, let cool and coarsely chop. Peel the apple, halve, core and cut  into small cubes. Put the rice in a bowl. In a bowl, stir together the crème fraîche and pesto, season with salt and pepper, stir in the apples, two-thirds of the nuts and the rice and fluff with a fork. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour. Serve garnished with apple wedges and wild herbs.

title: Shrimp Temaki
description: Rinse cucumber and cut into about 7 cm (approximately 3 inch) long and 5 mm (approximately 1/4  inch) wide strips. Rinse and trim scallions and cut into 7 cm (approximately 3 inch) strips and halve lengthwise.

title: Stuffed Fried Rice Balls
description: For the filling, rinse vegetables and finely chop. Heat some oil in a pan and cook ground beef until crumbly, add the vegetables and cook together. Add tomato puree, season with salt and pepper and simmer 30 minutes.

title: Stuffed Zucchini Blossoms
description: Carefully remove the small green sepals below the petals. Rinse blossom carefully in a bowl of cold water and drain.

title: Rice with Chicken and Vegetables
description: Peel garlic and chop finely. Rinse peppers, halve, core and dice or cut into strips. Peel carrots and slice into long strips. Brush beans. Blanch beefsteak tomato, peel, remove seeds and chop. In a pan sauté garlic and onion in olive oil. Add rice to pan and sauté briefly.

title: Rice with Chicken
description: Peel the carrot and cut into thin slices. Heat the peanut oil in a Dutch oven and saute the chicken pieces. Reduce the heat, add the onion, garlic, chile, spices and rice. Add the diced tomatoes with juice, a little chicken broth and carrots.

title: Rice with Ham and Pineapple
description: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan and saute pineapple briefly, add chile pepper and ham and saute for 3-4 minutes. Add oyster sauce and remove from the pan. Add rice to the pan and season with salt and pepper. Combine rice with pineapple mixture and spread in pineapple halves. Garnish with chile pepper halves and serve.

title: Risotto with Squash
description: Stir in 40 grams of butter and sprinkle with Parmesan and reserved squash. Serve immediately.

title: Rice with Chinese Cabbage, Peppers and Leeks
description: Rinse cabbage, pull apart leaves, cut into strips and mix with the prepared vegetables and the rice, season with salt and pepper.

title: Saffron Rice and Chicken
description: Rinse the chicken, pat dry and cut into small pieces. In a mortar, crush the coriander and poppy seeds with 1 teaspoon salt. Season the chicken with the mixture.

title: Mango Chicken and Rice
description: Rinse chicken breasts, pat dry and cut into bite-size pieces. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

title: Nasi Goreng
description: In a bowl, mix together the flour, egg and milk until smooth. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a skillet and saute the batter, turning once until golden brown. 1-2 minutes. Then roll up and cut into strips.

title: Stuffed Cabbage Leaves with Rice
description: Heat vegetable broth and put cabbage rolls in the pot. Cook for about 30 minutes on medium heat. Cook rice according to package instructions, drain. Rinse and quarter tomatoes, mix with rice. Season with salt and pepper. Place rice on plates and top with stuffed cabbage rolls.

title: Zucchini and Tomato Risotto
description: Rinse and remove strings from the celery and slice. Blanch the tomatoes in a pot of boiling water for 10 seconds. Drain, peel, quater, remove the seeds and finely dice. Carefully fold the zucchini, celery, and tomatoes into the rice during the final 5 minutes of cooking. Pluck the rosemary, finely chop half and stir into the rice along with the vegetables. Season with salt and pepper. Before serving, garnish with remaining rosemary and sprinkle with grated Parmesan.

title: Rice and Beans with Pickled Meat
description: Heat the oil in a skillet, add the onion and saute until translucent.  Add the meat and saute briefly. Remove from the heat.

title: Chicken Risotto with Pesto
description: Heat 4 tablespoons oil in a saucepan and sauté garlic and onion until soft. Rinse the rice in a sieve, add to the saucepan and sauté briefly, stirring constantly. Pour in wine and stir until liquid evaporates. Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot broth and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook for about 10 minutes. Add zucchini and bell pepper. Continue adding broth and cooking until rice is al dente, about 10 more minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Asian-Style Chicken Soup with Dried Mushrooms
description: Chop mushrooms. In a pot, combine mushrooms, chile, carrots, leeks, chicken broth and ginger. Bring to a boil and simmer 4 minutes. Add chicken breasts and simmer 5 minutes more. Remove chicken breast and cut crosswise into strips.

title: Spicy Rice
description: Cut the meat into bite-sized pieces, season with salt and pepper, and sauté in hot oil on each side for about 2 minutes. Remove and keep warm.

title: Nasi Goreng
description: Bring rice with turmeric and almost twice the amount of lightly salted water to a boil. Simmer, covered, on very low heat for about 25 minutes.

title: Vegetable Rice
description: Peel the onion and garlic and chop finely. Cut the chili pepper in half lengthwise, remove the seeds and chop very finely. Rinse and peel the vegetables. Cut celery into diagonal pieces. Cut carrots into thick slices, cutting the very thick carrot slices in half lengthwise. Cut the zucchini into large pieces. Cut the parsnip into matchsticks. Clean the mushrooms and cut in half (or quarter very large mushrooms).

title: Coconut Rice with Mango
description: Peel mangos and cut fruit away from pit into 1-cm (approximately 1/2-inch) thick slices. Brush mango slices with a little melted butter. Grill on both sides, 2-3 minutes.

title: Curried Vegetables and Rice
description: Heat oil in a pan over low heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add leek and diced pepper and stir-fry about 10 minutes. Stir in cooked rice and curry. Season with salt and Worcester sauce. Serve rice sprinkled with parsley.

title: Fried Rice with Fried Egg
description: Rinse and peel vegetables. Cut eggplant and zucchini into cubes, cut peppers into strips and tomatoes in half. Rinse the herbs, shake dry and chop finely. Peel garlic and also finely chop.

title: Rice Casserole
description: Beat egg yolks and butter until fluffy, add to rice pudding.

title: Chicken Fried Rice
description: In 2 tablespoons of the sesame oil, make an omelet with the eggs and salt to taste. Remove from pan and cut into pieces. Heat the remaining oil and quickly sauté the cooked rice, shrimp, all the cooked ingredients, and soy sauce, stirring continuously. Serve immediately.

title: Rice Paper Rolls with Shrimp
description: Rinse chile, remove seeds and finely chop.

title: Fruity Paella
description: Rinse mussels and brush well. Peel garlic and chop finely.

title: Rice Noodle Soup
description: When the broth has boiled vigorously once, reduce heat and simmer until reduced to 2.5-3 liters (approximately 10 1/2 to 12 1/2 cups) of liquid, 2-3 hours. While broth cooks, skim off foam occasionally. Pour broth carefully through a damp cloth strainer or a fine sieve. Discard solids.

title: Spring Rolls with Meat Filling
description: Place the rice noodles cold water and soak for about 30 minutes. Cook 1-2 minutes in boiling water (according to package directions) until al dente, drain and cool. Rinse the lettuce and remove the thick stems. Rinse the bean sprouts and cilantro and pluck the leaves from the stems.

title: Noodle Soup with Vegetables
description: Boil lemongrass, ginger, soy sauce and lime juice in the vegetable stock. Simmer over medium heat for about 5 minutes.

title: Rice Salad
description: Rinse and trim the cabbage and cut into strips. Blanch in boiling salted water for 12-15 minutes. Rinse in cold water and drain.

title: Risotto with Seafood
description: Rinse mussels and place in a pan with a little water. Cover and cook over medium heat until the mussels have opened. Discard any unopened mussels. Season risotto with salt and pepper. Rinse, shake dry and pluck the parsley leaves. Top the risotto with parsley leaves, mussels and shrimp. Serve immediately.

title: Risotto with Tuna
description: Put risotto into bowls and serve.

title: Saffron Rice with Broccoli
description: Finely grate a little lemon zest, then squeeze juice from lemon. Combine 2 tablespoons lemon juice with oil, horseradish, and lemon zest. Season with salt and pepper. Pour marinade over broccoli. Serve rice topped with broccoli.

title: Peppers Stuffed with Rice, Pinenuts and Hazelnuts
description: Rinse the basil, shake dry and chop. Set some aside for garnish, stir the rest into the rice mixture. In a skillet, heat the butter and sauté the hazelnuts until lightly golden.

title: Asparagus Risotto with Trout
description: Peel and chop shallots. Heat oil in a saucepan. Add shallots and cook until translucent. Add rice and cook, stirring, 1-2 minutes. Bring broth to a boil in a small pot, then reduce heat and keep warm.  Ladle 1/4 of the hot broth and wine into rice and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth and remaining wine in this manner until rice is al dente, about 25 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Risi Bisi (Rice and Peas)
description: Rinse the rice, and cook in the broth according to package directions, Stir in the thawed peas during the last few minutes of cooking time.

title: Paella
description: Cut the chicken and pork into bite-sized pieces and cut the squid into small pieces.

title: Paella
description: Rinse the chicken and pat dry. Cut the ham into small cubes and the chorizo into thick slices. Rinse the fish fillets, pat dry, cut into bite-size pieces and sprinkle with lemon juice. Rinse the prawns and pat dry.

title: Strawberry Risotto
description: Sweat the shallots in hot oil in a pan until translucent. Add the rice and deglaze with white wine while with stirring. Add half the wine and the finely chopped strawberries.

title: Orange Chicken Legs with Orzo
description: Gently separate skin from the meat and place some sage leaves under the skin, season with salt and pepper.

title: Spring Rolls with Ground Pork Filling
description: For the spring roll, soak glass noodles in a bowl with hot water for about 10 minutes. Rinse scallions, trim and finely chop. Drain glass noodles and chop with scissors. Pat dry crabmeat and chop. Mix crabmeat with noodles, ground pork and chopped green scallions. Mix shrimp paste with fish sauce until smooth and mix with cilantro leaves to ground pork noodle mixture. Mix all well and season with salt and pepper. Spoon 1 tablespoon of the filling onto rice leaves, turn sideways, moisten the upper end with water, roll up and press firmly.

title: Vegetable Curry
description: Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat, add the potatoes and carrots and cook, stirring frequently, for 10 minutes. Pour in a little hot water and cook another 10 minutes.

title: Saffron Risotto
description: Add half of parmesan and stir in butter, place risotto into bowls and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Serve.

title: Paella with Chicken
description: Rinse the rice. Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large frying pan and cook the chicken thighs about 15 minutes, Add pork and cook 5 minutes. Remove the meat from the pan, set aside and season with salt. Add garlic, onion, bell pepper and drained artichokes to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes, remove.

title: Asian Green Salad with Tuna
description: Cook noodles according to package instructions until al dente, drain and mix with watercress puree.

title: Pumpkin Risotto
description: Melt remaining butter in a large pot. Cook remaining onion until translucent. Press garlic through a garlic press into the pot and sauté briefly. Add the rice and cook briefly, stirring. Add wine and cook until reduced by half.

title: Pollock with Rice
description: Peel the onion and cut into thin wedges. Peel the garlic and press through a garlic press. Heat the remaining olive oil and saute the onions and garlic. Add the rice and saute briefly and season with salt and pepper. Pour in the tomato juice and vegetable broth, cover and cook over low heat for 20 minutes. Rinse the cilantro, pluck leaves from the stems and finely chop half.

title: Scallops with Spiced Rice
description: Just before serving, stir the melted butter and cashews into the rice and cook until heated through, about 1 minute   Season with lemon juice and serve.

title: Rice with Vegetables
description: Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the scallions briefly. Add the fennel and carrots and saute everything for 20 minutes. Mix in the cooked rice. Rinse the parsley, finely chop and sprinkle on the rice and vegetables. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Fruit Rice Salad with Shrimp
description: Rinse and dry lettuce, arrange letuce leaves in serving bowls.Combine mayonnaise, yogurt, curry and onion to make a dressing. Place rice mixture onto lettuce leaves, drizzle with sauce. Season with salt and pepper and garnish with reserved scallions. Serve.

title: Hoso Maki
description: Cut nori sheets in half crosswise.

title: Sauteed Rice Noodles with Monkfish and Vegetables
description: Heat 1 tablespoons sunflower oil in a nonstick skillet (or wok), and saute the almonds until golden brown, remove with a slotted spoon. Add the monkfish to the pan and sear 1 minute on each side. Remove.

title: Semolina Pudding with Fruit
description: Separate the eggs. Using an electric hand mixer, mix quark, egg yolks, sugar, lemon zest and juice in a bowl. Stir in the semolina. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into the quark mixture. Pour into a buttered baking dish.

title: Asian Noodle Salad with Vegetables
description: Rinse cabbage and cut into strips. Peel and cut carrot into fine strips.Rinse tomato, cut into quarters, remove seeds and cut into strips.

title: Rice Noodles with Shiitake
description: Prepare rice noodles according to package instructions.

title: Fruity Rice with Shrimp
description: Rinse the currants gently, remove any stems, dust with the sugar and drizzle with the lemon juice. Peel the onion and cut into small cubes. Rinse the cilantro, shake dry and finely chop the leaves.

title: Coconut Rice with Mango
description: Peel mango and cut fruit into slices. Serve rice in a small bowl, cover with mango and garnish with sesame seeds.

title: Strawberry Risotto
description: Heat the oil in a saucepan, add the shallots and cook until translucent. Add the rice and stir until well coated, Add half the wine and the finely chopped strawberries.

title: Quick and Easy Paella
description: Preheat the oven 180°C (approximately 350°F). Rinse, clean and chop peppers and leeks. Peel garlic and chop finely. Heat the butter in an ovenproof pan and saute garlic, peppers, leeks, bay leaf, saffron and thawed peas until crisp-tender. Add the seafood, rice and the broth, season with salt and pepper and stir to combine. Bake until the rice is tender and the seafood is cooked through, about 10 minutes.

title: Spanish Rice with Chorizo
description: Cut olives into thin slices and stir into the rice. Season with salt, pepper and a pinch of cayenne, or more to taste. Stir in the chorizo and serve.

title: Vegetable Pan with Rice and Meatballs
description: Cook rice according to package directions. Toast the nuts in a dry skillet. Rinse bell peppers, cut in half, remove the core, and dice. Rinse spring onions and cut into thin rings. Blanch bell peppers and broccoli for 3 minutes in boiling salted water, rinse with cold water and drain. Cut chile peppers into thin rings and drain bean sprouts.

title: Vegetable and Shrimp Rice Pilaf
description: Heat the oil in a skillet, add the onion and garlic and saute until translucent. Crumble the chile and add to the onions. Stir in the celery, raisins, pine nuts and rice until well combined, then pour in the broth. Add salt, pepper and cumin. cover and cook over low heat until the rice is tender, about 25 minutes. Stir in the shrimp and peas 5 minutes before the rice is done. Stir in the parsley.

title: Ginger Salmon on Saffron Rice
description: Rinse the carrots and celery. Remove the strings from the celery and thinly slice. Dice the carrots finely. Cut the chile in half lengthwise, remove the seeds and chop very finely. Peel and finely chop the ginger. Rinse the salmon and pat dry with paper towels. Season the salmon with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Heat oil in a skillet and saute the salmon with the chopped ginger until just cooked through, turning the salmon midway,  about 8 minutes, remove and keep warm.

title: Saffron Rice with Seafood
description: Rinse rice and boil with double amount of lightly salted water and saffron, covered about 20 minutes.

title: Vegetable Flan with Tomato Sauce
description: Preheat the oven to 175°C (approximately 350°F). Grease 4 ramekins or custard cups. In a bowl, beat the eggs, mix in the vegetables and rice and season with salt and pepper. Pour into greased ramekins. Place the ramekins in a large baking dish and pour hot water to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins, into the baking dish. Bake until the custards are set, about 30 minutes. Heat the tomato sauce, season to taste and spread on plates. Run a spatula around the edge of the ramekins and invert the custards onto the tomato sauce.

title: Rice, Pasta and Lentils with Tomato Sauce
description: Boil the tomatoes with the tomato purée. Add salt, pepper and chili to taste.

title: Forest Mushroom Risotto
description: Heat the chicken stock. Sauté the onion in oil, add bay leaf and porcini powder and the pressed garlic. Sprinkle the rice into the pan and saute until translucent, then pour in the wine and bring to a boil. Pour in 1/4 of the hot broth and season with salt and pepper. Cook the rice about 20 minutes over low heat while, stirring occasionally until the liquid is absorbed and then pour in the rest of the hot broth and cook until done. The risotto should be al dente and creamy.

title: Coconut Rice with Shrimp
description: Heat oil in a pot and sauté onions and ginger over medium heat, stirring occasionally until the onion is translucent. Add the rice, stirring to coat. Add the curry, turmeric and bay leaf, stirring to coat. Add the coconut milk and vegetable broth, season with salt cover and simmer over low heat until the rice is almost tender,  about 15 minutes.

title: Asian Noodle Salad with Chicken and Papaya
description: Rinse cabbage, cut into strips. Rinse and dry snow peas, cut diagonally into thin strips. Peel papaya, halve, remove seeds and cut into slices.

title: Paella
description: Season chicken thighs with salt, cut pork into bite-sized pieces and season. In a large skillet with some oil, cook meat until browned.

title: Jambalaya
description: Add the rice and season with chile, salt, pepper, tomato paste and cumin, cover the pot again and lower the heat. Cook rice about 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, adding more broth if necessary.

title: Rice Cake
description: Bake in a preheated oven (180°C) (approximately 350°F) for about 30 minutes. Bake. Remove and let cool. Cut in pieces. Serve lukewarm.

title: Risotto with Chicken Legs
description: Rinse chicken legs, pat dry and divide at the joint.

title: Rice with Vegetables and Shrimp
description: Peel shallot and garlic and chop finely.

title: Stuffed Grape Leaves
description: Briefly dip the grape leaves into boiling water and drain. Spread on a kitchen towel to dry and remove the stems.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Trim fresh mushrooms and mince if desired. Drain porcini mushrooms, collect soaking liquid and mince mushrooms as needed.

title: Rice Pudding, Two Ways
description: Stir the butter and sugar into the rice and mix until well combined. Transfer half of the rice to a serving dish. Coarsely chop the chocolate and stir into the remaining rice until melted. Transfer the chocolate rice to a serving dish, sprinkle both with cinnamon and serve.

title: Rice Salad with Peas and Shrimp
description: Blanch the peas in a pot of boiling salted water until tender, 3-4 minutes. Drain, run under cold water and drain again.

title: Spicy Rice with Mussels
description: Grind all whole spices in a mortar until finely crushed. Heat oil in a pan and sauté shallots, crushed garlic and all spices. Add tomatoes, sauté briefly. Add broth and rinsed rice, bring to a boil and cook, covered, for about 5 minutes on lowest heat. Add mussels and rinsed beans and cook for additional 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and add herbs. Serve.

title: Pancakes with Fruity Rice Filling
description: Wash the rice under running water in a colander and rinse. Boil the rice in a pot with twice the amount of water just over the top of the rice with a little salt. Cover and let it cook for approximately 15 minutes at low heat. Let the rice grains swell.

title: Bananas with Pepper Salsa
description: Peel bananas, sprinkle with curry and paprika.

title: Jambalaya (Creole Rice)
description: Rinse chicken breast fillets, pat dry and cut in half lengthwise, into 4 small portions.

title: Nasi Goreng
description: Peel carrot and trim. Rinse cabbage. Chop cabbage and carrot.

title: Rice Balls with Spicy Vegetables
description: Rinse bell peppers and chile, cut in half, remove seeds and cut into short, thin strips.

title: Lamb with Lemon Rice and Vegetables
description: Rinse eggplant, cut crosswise into quarters, then lengthwise into 0.5 cm (approximately 1/8 inch) chunks. Soak in cold salted water 10 minutes.

title: Osso Buco with Saffron Risotto
description: Preheat the oven to 100°C (approximately 212°F). Peel the garlic, onions and carrot. Rinse celery and parsley and pat dry. Cut all into small cubes, add to veal and cook briefly. Stir in the tomato paste and cook briefly, then deglaze with red wine and add the peeled tomatoes. Stir in the bay leaves and lemon zest and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, cover and bake until the veal is very tender, 2.5-3 hours.

title: Vegetable Wild Rice Salad
description: Cook wild rice mix according to package directions, drain well.

title: Eggplant with Rice Stuffing
description: Blanch tomatoes for a few seconds, then peel, quarter, core and dice. Combine tomatoes with the reserved broth, season with salt and pepper and spread in a baking dish. Pat the eggplant halves dry.

title: Tofu with Rice and Green Beans
description: Cut the tofu into bite-sized pieces. Rinse the scallions and thinly slice. Peel and mince the garlic.

title: Fried Rice with Vegetables
description: Rinse and trim beans, cut into 3 cm (approximately 1 inch) long pieces. Blanch in salted water for about 6-8 minutes or until al dente.

title: Corn, Beans and Tomatoes
description: Add corn and tomato and simmer until corn is tender, about 8 minutes. Rinse herbs, shake dry and chop. Mix herbs and butter with vegetables. Sprinkle with coarsely shredded cheese and serve with brown rice, if desired.

title: Saffron Rice with Tuna
description: Add rice and season with saffron and pepper, saute briefly. Add hot broth and simmer for 8 minutes. Rinse and chop herbs. Add herbs and olives to the pan, mix well. Add drained tuna and mix well. Season to taste and arrange on plates. Garnish with lemon wedges and serve.

title: Stir-fried Vegetable Rice with Turkey
description: Add the thawed vegetables to the wok and cook on high heat for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the rice and fry for 3 minutes while continuing to stire. Add the turkey and onions back to the pan and fry for an additional minute. Season with soy sauce, salt and pepper to taste and serve.

title: Turkey with Rice
description: For the filling, mix all ingredients together and stuff inside of turkey.

title: Hearty Rice with Meat and Olives
description: Add the corn, peas, olives and raisins and cook for a few minutes. Serve immediately.

title: Paella with Mixed Vegetables
description: Heat the vegetable broth.

title: Rice with Redfish and Vegetables
description: Rinse fish, pat dry and cut into bite-size pieces. Peel garlic and chop finely. Rinse and trim peppers, leeks and mushrooms and chop.

title: Vegetable Rice with Sausage
description: Peel garlic and chop finely. Rinse peppers, cut in half, remove the core and dice into small pieces. Blanch the beefsteak tomatoes, peel, remove seeds and chop. Take bacon and sausage from the pan and fry the garlic in the remaining fat. Add the diced peppers for approximately 3 minutes. Sauté, add the tomatoes, stir and cook for 10 minutes. Simmer until the liquid is almost completely evaporated. Brush a large baking dish with oil and preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Rice and Fruit Salad
description: Serve in bowls garnished with mint.

title: Rainbow Rice Cakes
description: Using food coloring, color each portion a different color. (work quickly,before the gelatin sets.) Grease a springform pan or other pan with a removable bottom and pour different color layers of the rice cake into the pan. Refrigerate at least 2 hours to set firmly. To serve, loosen the rice cake from the mold and cut into cubes.

title: Lamb and Asparagus Risotto
description: Heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the garlic and lemon zest and saute over low heat until the garlic is soft, but not browned.

title: Asian Noodle Salad with Tuna
description: Rinse snow peas and trim the ends, cook in boiling salted water for 4 minutes. Drain and rinse in cold water, drain again.

title: Stir-Fried Rice with Shrimp and Vegetables
description: Rinse, peel and thinly slice the carrots. Peel the onions and dice. Cook the rice according to package directions, drain. Heat the oil in a large skillet.

title: Beef and Vegetable Rice
description: Add the rice and cook for a few minutes. Add the broth and tomato juice, bring to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover and cook 8-10 minutes. Let stand until the liquid has been absorbed.

title: Parmesan Risotto with Sautéed Vegetables
description: Heat 1 tablespoons of olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter in a large pot and sauté the onions until translucent. Stir in the rice and sauté briefly. Deglaze with the white wine, allow most of it to evaporate and stir in enough vegetable broth to fully cover the rice. Cover and simmer over low heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring and adding vegetable broth often.

title: Cheesy Risotto with Sautéed Vegetables
description: Rinse the eggplant, zucchini and bell pepper and cut into small cubes. Peel and dice the onion and garlic. Heat the remaining oil in a large pan and sauté the onion and garlic briefly. Add the rest of the vegetables, season with salt and pepper and cook for about 5 minutes.

title: Grape Leaf and Rice Rolls
description: Dip the grape leaves briefly into the boiling water and drain on a kitchen towel. Cut the stems from the grape leaves.

title: Artichoke Paella
description: Peel and finely chop onion and garlic. Add olive oil to a medium pan and cook onion and garlic until translucent. Add rice and stir until coated. Add wine and cook until evaporated, stirring occasionally. Add broth and bloomed saffron and cook about 10 minutes over medium heat stirring occasionally. Stir in carrot slices, tomato, and bean seeds. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until the carrots are tender, about 10 minutes. If necessary, pour in a little extra broth and stir occasionally.

title: Sweet Rice Casserole
description: Separate eggs, whisk together egg yolks and fold into rice mixture. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold in carefully too.

title: Pea Risotto
description: Add the rice and thyme and sauté. Add white wine and cook, stirring, until evaporated. Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot broth and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Asian Noodle Soup with Chicken Meatballs
description: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain.

title: Steamed Rice Balls
description: Mix both types of flour in a bowl with a pinch of salt. Add enough water to form a soft, smooth dough. Shape into 16 balls. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, use a steamer insert. Line steamer insert with baking parchment and set balls in it then dampen over high heat for about 15 minutes. (Successively cook balls if not all fit at once.)

title: Coconut Rice with Lentils
description: Add soy sauce to taste, remove the lemon grass and curry leaves and spoon into bowls.

title: Cevapcici with Rice
description: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a saucepan and saute the onions until translucent. Remove about half and set aside. Add the bell pepper, tomato paste, and broth to the pan and bring to a boil. Add the rice and cook until tender, about 25 minutes. Season the cooked rice with paprika, salt and pepper.

title: Tofu Vegetable Rice
description: Rinse scallions, drain and pat dry and cut into rings. Rinse celery, drain and pat dry and slice. Rinse peppers, drain and pat dry and cut in half and remove stems, seeds and ribs and cut into thin slices. Rinse snow peas, drain and cut into thin slices. Heat oil in a pan and sauté prepared vegetables for about 3-4 minutes and stir frequently.

title: Rice with Fish and Vegetables
description: Rinse and peel scallions and cut white part of scallion in thin strips and green part of scallion in rings. Sauté for about 1-2 minutes. Drain on paper towels.

title: Risotto with Mushrooms
description: Add the mushrooms at the end, along with the butter, parsley and Parmesan. Season with salt and peper and serve spooned into bowls.

title: Rice Patties with Tomato Sauce
description: For the sauce, blanch tomatoes, drain and peel. Cut tomato into quarters and remove stems and seeds. Pass seeds through a sieve and collect juice.Cut tomatoes into cubes and mix with tomato juice. Add chives and season with lemon juice, sugar, salt and pepper.

title: Rice Pudding with Coconut, Vanilla and Mango
description: For the topping: Peel the mango, remove the pit, cut the flesh into small cubes and puree with the buttermilk and honey in a blender. Spoon the rice pudding into serving bowls. Top with buttermilk mango mixture and sprinkle with coconut.

title: Dates in Bacon
description: Peel and halve garlic. Heat oil in a pan and saute garlic for a little. Remove garlic and saute dates, stirring vigorously. Season with pepper and serve.

title: Gluten-Free Rice Cake with Zucchini
description: Heat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F) top and bottom heat.

title: Rice and Cabbage Salad with Bacon
description: Rinse and dry cabbage, cut into strips. Cut bacon into thin strips. Peel onion and chop. Heat oil in a pan and sauté onion and bacon. Add cabbage and sauté together briefly. Season with salt and pepper, add broth and vinegar. Cover and cook until cabbage is al dente, for about 8 minutes. Place cooled rice on plates, top with cabbage mixture and let rest for about 15 minutes. Serve.

title: Meatballs with Pepper Rice
description: Rinse the peppers, cut in half, trim and cut into pieces. Peel the onion and finely chop. Sauté for 2-3 minutes with the pepper in 2 tablespoons hot oil. Add the tomatoes and simmer gently for about 10 minutes.

title: Risotto with Smoked Salmon and Shrimp
description: Peel and mince shallots. Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a pan, then cook shallots. Add rice and sauté briefly. Deglaze with champagne, asparagus stock and broth. Add 2 ladles of water and boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.

title: Rice Paper Spring Rolls
description: Soak the cellophane noodles in hot water for about 10 minutes, drain and chop with scissors.

title: Mushroom and Spinach Risotto
description: Sauté rice in hot oil for 1-2 minutes in a pot until glassy.

title: Fresh Pea Soup with Steelhead Trout
description: Bring white wine, water, bay leaf, peppercorns, 1/2 teaspoon salt, dill stems and onions to a boil in a pot.

title: Saffron Risotto with Peas and Fennel
description: Rinse fennel bulbs (set aside greens), trim and cut into strips. Cook in a pot of boiling lightly salted water with a little lemon juice until al dente. Drain fennel.

title: Roe and Scallion Nigiri
description: Let rice cool.

title: Perch Sushi Rolls
description: Cut the fish into thin strips and then into pieces. Thinly slice the celery and radishes. With slightly dampened hands, form the rice into small oblong balls.

title: Fried Cabbage with Garlic and Mint
description: Cook rice in a pot of salted boiling water for about 12 minutes. Heat oil in a wok, add prepared vegetables and garlic and fry for a few minutes while stirring.

title: Lemon Beans with Fried Rice
description: Rinse scallions and cut into 5-6 cm long pieces (approximately 2 inches). Cut pepper into quarters, remove seeds and ribs and cut into fine strips.

title: Rice and Pepper Salad
description: Whisk vinegar with mustard and season with salt and pepper, then gradually add oil, whisking. Combine rice and vegetables and toss with the dressing. Let stand for 10 minutes. Cut ham into cubes, sprinkle on top of salad and serve.

title: Tomato and Mozzarella Risotto
description: Heat half the butter in a saucepan and sauté the onions and garlic until translucent. Add the rice and cook, stirring until glossy and well coated. Add the white wine and cook, stirring occasionally until the rice has absorbed the wine. Season with salt and pepper. Add enough vegetable broth to cover the rice by an inch. Cook, stirring frequently for about 30 minutes, adding more broth as one amount has been absorbed until the rice is creamy with a slight bite.

title: Lamb Curry with Spiced Rice
description: Stir half the basmati rice into a pot of boiling salted water. Add the cinnamon, cloves and cardamom, and simmer for 15 minutes. Cook the other half of the basmati rice in another pot of boiling salted water. Stir in the saffron and simmer for 15 minutes. Season the lamb with salt and pepper to taste, and stir in the creme fraiche. Drain both rices and toss together. Serve with the lamb curry.

title: Papaya Stuffed with Coconut Rice
description: Coarsely grate 100 g (approximately 1/2 cup) coconut meat. Cook coconut, long grain rice and wild rice in boiling salted water until rice is tender and water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Or, prepare according to directions on rice package. Cut turkey breast into strips. Rinse scallions, shake dry and cut into rings. Halve papayas, scrape out seeds and carefully remove inner flesh with a spoon, being careful not to puncture outer walls. Dice papaya flesh. Mix raspberry vinegar and 2 tablespoons coconut water and season with sugar, salt and pepper, to taste. Gradually whisk oil into dressing

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Preheat the oven to 160 °C /325°F. Rinse the dill, shake dry, pluck leaves and finely chop. Stir the mushrooms and dill into the rice. Season with salt to taste and the ginger. Grate the cheese and stir into the rice.

title: Vegetable Rice
description: Cook the rice covered over low heat for about 15 minutes.

title: Chicken Rice Soup with Summer Vegetables
description: Remove the chicken breasts and cool slightly. Loosen the meat from the skin and bones. Cut the meat into pieces. Rinse the lemon and cut into slices. Add the meat, rice and lemon slices to the vegetable stock. Reheat everything briefly. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

title: Chicken with Saffron Rice and Braised Celery
description: Cook the rice along with the saffron according to package directions.

title: Vegetable Casserole with Turkey and Rice
description: Clean mushrooms. Peel garlic and chop finely. Cut turkey cutlets into wide strips. Heat two tablespoons of oil in a pan and brown meat on all sides, season with salt and remove from the pan.

title: Melon and Cucumber Rice Salad
description: Cut the feta cheese into 2 cm-thick cubes (approximately 3/4 inch). Combine cucumber, melon, feta cheese, trail mix and rice in a salad bowl. For the dressing: Cut the chives into rolls.

title: Rice Casserole
description: Mix the quark and maple syrup. Mix into the rice. Pour half of the rice into a  buttered baking dish.

title: Tomato Lamb Casserole
description: Peel the onions and chop coarsely. Rinse the tomatoes and cut in half or quarters, depending on size. Heat the remaining olive oil. Peel the garlic and squeeze through a press into the oil. Add the onion and tomato and cook briefly.

title: Rice Paper Rolls
description: For the rolls, chop peanuts. Remove chile seeds and finely chop. Mix together. Lay sheets of rice paper on a work surface and moisten with water to soften.

title: Gouda Rice Salad

title: Saffron Arancini Stuffed with Meat and Peas
description: Meanwhile, cook the rice in salted water according to package instructions. Mix the saffron with 2 tablespoons lukewarm water then mix into the rice with the cheese and 2 eggs. Form into 8 balls, make a well in the center of each ball and fill with 1 tablespoon meat mixture. Shape the rice back into balls, fully encasing the meat.

title: Zucchini and Pea Risotto with Parmesan and Thyme
description: Deglaze with the wine and a ladle of stock and stir continuously until liquid is completely absorbed. Continue adding stock, 1 ladle at a time, until rice is almost tender, around 30 minutes.

title: Rice with Vegetables
description: Drain palm hearts in a sieve. Quarter peppers, remove seeds and ribs, rinse and chop. Rinse leek and cut into rings. Cut palm hearts into pieces.

title: Spiced Rce with Mussels
description: Place all the coriander seeds, cloves, allspice berries, cardamom and cinnamon sticks in a mortar and finely crush. Crush the garlic through a garlic press. Heat oil in a pan and sauté shallots, crushed garlic, all the spices and the tomato cubes and sauté briefly. Add the broth and the washed rice, bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, cover and cook about 5 minutes. Add the mussels and beans and cook until the rice is tender, about 15 minutes longer. Remove from the heat and let stand 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and with a fork, stir in the herbs.

title: Rice with Beans and Squash
description: Rinse scallions and cut into thin rings. Place in pan with the beans and the pumpkin cubes. Saute in hot olive oil. Add broth, wine and cumin, bring to a boil, cover and simmer about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix in rice, peanuts and parsley.

title: Rice and Vegetable Pan with Sausage
description: Sauté the onion in 1 tablespoon of oil, add rice, pour in the broth and allow to swell at low temperature in a closed pan for about 20 minutes. Heat the remaining oil in a pan, add the sausages, fry briefly, and remove from the pan. Add pepper pieces and peas into the pan, braise in its own juice at low temperature for 3-4 minutes, add the sausages with parsley again, with salt, pepper and paprika spice. When the rice is ready and cooked and all the liquid has absorbed, add the rest of the ingredients into the pan. Mix well, heat at low temperature and season to taste. Serve.

title: Rice with Shrimp
description: Rinse and dry scallions. Cut white parts into small cubes and green parts into rings.

title: Spiced Rice with Nuts, Raisins and Bell Pepper
description: Rinse the rice in a sieve under running water and drain.

title: Dolmas
description: Rinse the grape leaves under cold water and pat dry, Place two overlapping leaves on a work surface.

title: Spicy Vegetable Rice
description: Peel the onion and garlic, and chop finely. Rinse and peel the vegetables. Slit the chile pepper lengthwise, remove seeds and cut into thin strips. Rinse, trim and cut the celery into thin slices. Rinse the bell peppers, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs, and cut into thin strips.

title: Rice Pudding
description: Finely chop pistachios and set aside 1 tablespoon for garnish. Stir remaining pistachios, raisins and rose water into rice pudding. Cover rice pudding and refrigerate for 2-3 hours.

title: Chirashi Sushi with Fish
description: Cut the fish fillets into small, fine pieces. Distribute the sushi rice in bowls and arrange the prepared ingredients on top, then sprinkle with Tobiko roe. Serve with soy sauce and pickled ginger.

title: Lemony Crab Risotto
description: Heat olive oil in a pan and saute the rice and onion until soft. Press the garlic and add to the rice. Add the zucchini and saute briefly. Pour in the white wine and vegetable stock, and cook for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

title: Pistachio Rice with Crispy Tempura Vegetables
description: Peel mango, cut flesh from the pit and puree. Finely chop chile pepper and ginger and stir into the mango. Season dip with salt and pepper.

title: Fish Curry with Basmati Rice and Lime
description: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a pan. Add red onion, chile pepper, scallions and sprouts and sauté briefly. Mix with the rice. Keep warm.

title: Saffron Rice with Prawns
description: Peel onion and cut into strips. Peel ginger and finely chop. Peel garlic. Peel prawns to the tail, devein, rinse and pat dry.

title: Nasi Goreng with Two Rices
description: Toss shrimp with 1 tablespoon oil and set aside. Peel onions and garlic. Dice 2 onions, cut the remaining into rings. Peel cucumber, half lengthwise, remove the seeds and cut the cucumber halves into slices. Sprinkle cucumber with chili powder and salt. Rinse scallions and finely chop.

title: Individual Rice Puddings with Strawberry-Rhubarb Compote
description: For the strawberry-rhubarb compote: Rinse the rhubarb and cut into bite-sized pieces. Rinse and halve the strawberries. Bring the currant jelly and water to a boil in a saucepan. Add the rhubarb and strawberries and simmer for 5-6 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.

title: Roast Beef with Onion Sauce and Vegetable Rice
description: For the onion sauce, peel the onions and cut into slices. Heat in a skillet and saute the onions until browned. Deglaze with the broth, bring to a boil and simmer for about 45 minutes over medium heat.

title: Rice and Tuna Salad with Stuffed Cherry Tomatoes
description: Trim the cherry tomatoes, rinse and cut out a lid. Hollow the cherry tomatoes with a melon baller and pat dry with paper towels.

title: Rice Pudding with Caramel Sauce and Fruit Salad
description: Beat the whipping cream until stiff. Remove the vanilla bean pod from the rice and fold in the whipped cream.

title: Lime Risotto with Pork
description: Peel kohlrabi and dice finely. Peel onion and garlic and chop finely. Heat 40 grams (approximately 3 tablespoons) butter in a saucepan. Add kohlrabi, onion and garlic and sauté briefly. Add rice and sauté until soft. Heat vegetable stock to a simmer. Tear kaffir lime leaves in half and add to the rice. Deglaze with white wine. Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot stock and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add stock in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, 20-25 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Lamb Chops with Scallions and Curry Rice
description: Remove lamb chops from the pan and keep warm. Deglaze pan drippings with vermouth and add peppercorns, whisk in crème fraîche and simmer for several minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Risotto with Calamari
description: Rinse the calamari and season with a little salt. Place the calamari in a pan and cover the pan. Cook the calamari for 2 minutes. Remove the lid from the pon and cook the calamari until all the liquid gets evaporated. Increase the heat, add the remaining olive oil and fry the calamari. Season with salt, pepper and lemon juice. Draw from heat and let cool down.

title: Stuffed Eggplant and Tomatoes with Rice and Ground Meat
description: Cook rice in salted water according to package directions. Score remaining tomatoe, blanch for 1 minute with boiling water, drain, rinse in cold water and remove skin. Cut tomato in half and remove seeds. Dice the flesh into cubes.

title: Rice Dumplings with Coconut Vegetables
description: Rinse and finely chop scallions. Halve pepperoncini and remove seeds and ribs, chop finely. Peel and finely grate ginger. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan and saute scallions, pepperoncini and ginger for a few minutes. Add vegetables to rice and mix well. Rinse cilantro, shake dry and pluck off leaves, then chop coarsely.

title: Risotto Alla Milanese
description: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large Dutch oven and sauté onion and garlic until soft. Add rice and cook while stirring until translucent. Pour in wine and continue stirring until the rice has absorbed the liquid. Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot stock and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed.

title: Mushroom-Cucumber Risotto
description: Heat the chicken stock in a saucepan.

title: Paella
description: Cut an X into each tomato and briefly place in boiling water. Remove from water and remove skin. Cut the tomatoes in half, remove the seeds and stem and cut into cubes. Peel the onion and garlic and chop finely.

title: Red Wine Risotto to Duck Breast
description: In the meantime, score the skin of the duck breasts crosswise. Place the duck breast, skin side down, in a hot pan and add a good amount of water. Allow the water to evaporate while browning the skin then turn the breast over. Reduce the heat and cook the duck breast 18-20 minutes longer.

title: Creole Stew with Pork
description: Season pork with salt and pepper. Heat remaining olive oil in a nonstick skillet and sear pork on all sides. Add a dash of water to the pan and cook pork tenderloin for 15-20 minutes more.

title: Caribbean Fish Pot with Papaya and Pomegranate
description: Peel and dice shallots. Heat oil in a pot and sauté shallots. Add mace, cinnamon and 1 teaspoon ofcayenne pepper and sauté briefly. Pour in fish stock and coconut milk. Add papaya and celery and simmer for 5 minutes.

title: Rice with Carrots, Pine Nuts and Raisins
description: Peel and slice carrots. Rinse, trim and slice scallions crosswise.

title: Sushi Rice Salad
description: Rinse the snow peas and finely chop. Rinse and peel the carrot and cut into thin slices. Heat 2 teaspoons of oil and cook the shrimp for 2-3 minutes. Cut the ginger finely. Place the rice in a bowl. Mix the shrimp, snow peas, carrots and ginger together and place on the rice.

title: Herbed Rice with Raisins and Pine Nuts
description: Heat the olive oil in a pot. Add the onion and cook until golden. Peel and press the garlic. Stir the scallions and garlic into the pot, and cook until fragrant. Remove the onion mixture from the pot and set aside. Stir the spinach and water into the pot, and cook for 5-8 minutes. Using and immersion blender, puree the spinach. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Rice Paper Rolls with Ginger and Vegetables
description: Remove outer leaves of cabbage, if needed, then cut into strips. Rinse cabbage and spin dry. Peel carrot and cut into long, thin strips. Rinse bean sprouts and spin dry. Peel ginger and finely chop.

title: Salmon with Wasabi-soy Marinade and Vegetable Rice
description: Rinse rice thoroughly under running water. Boil water and salt in a saucepan. Add rice and cook for about 20 minutes. Stir in vinegar.

title: Hearty Lamb Stew
description: Heat olive oil in a large pot. Sauté the lamb, onions and garlic until browned. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the peppers, rice and spices and sauté briefly. Stir in the tomato paste and beef broth, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.

title: Pumpkin Risotto with Fried Sage
description: Stir in parmesan and remaining butter and season with salt and pepper.

title: Tomatoes Stuffed with Tuna and Rice
description: Chop the tomato flesh into small cubes. Rinse and finely chop the scallions. Rinse the herbs thoroughly, set some aside for garnish and chop the rest. Drain the tuna and break apart.
types: ['fruit-vegetable', 'Cooking', 'Fish', 'Vegetable', 'Onion', 'Herb', 'Rice', 'Main Course', 'Easy', 'Meal for Four', 'everyday meal', 'Quick', 'High-protein', 'High-protein Fish Dish']

title: Shrimp and Mango Kebabs
description: Cook the wild rice according to package directions.

title: Risotto with Asparagus and Prosciutto
description: Bring broth to a boil in a small pot, then reduce heat and keep warm. Heat oil in a pot over medium heat and sauté chopped shallot and add rice, stirring to coat with oil. Add white wine and cook, stirring, until evaporated. Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot broth and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently.

title: Stuffed Zucchini
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Risotto with Vegetables and Herbs
description: Bring the broth to a boil in a small pot, then reduce heat and keep warm. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pot over medium heat and sauté onion. Add the rice. Add wine and cook, stirring, until evaporated. Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot broth and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes.

title: Risotto with Chicken and Mushrooms
description: Trim the mushrooms and cut in half or quarters, depending on size. Rinse the chicken, pat dry and cut into strips. Sauté mushrooms in 1 tablespoon hot butter until golden brown for 2-3 minutes. Add the chicken to the pan and cook until done. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Stuffed Rice Balls
description: For breading, whisk 2 eggs in a deep dish or similar container and season with salt and pepper. Place flour in another dish and breadcrumbs in another dish. Cut the cheese into small cubes.

title: Zucchini Stuffed with Fennel and Rice
description: Rinse fennel and cut out stalk, chop. Rinse fennel leaves and chop finely. Drain tomatoes and cut into fine strips. Chop almonds coarsely and set 2 tablespoons aside. Rinse and halve zucchini, scrape out pulp and chop.

title: Rice Pudding with Sour Cherries
description: For the rice pudding: Rinse the lemon in hot water and cut 1 thin strip of lemon zest with a vegetable peeler. Bring to a boil with the milk, cinnamon, rice and sugar. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 20 minutes over medium heat, stirring frequently. Remove the cinnamon and lemon zest.

title: Spicy Vegetable Stir-fry with Rice
description: Heat the oil in a large nonstick wok and stir-fry the onions and cabbage until light golden brown, stirring, for 3 minutes. Add the peppers and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes. Squeeze the juice from 1 lime and add to the wok along with the melon and sambal oelek. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Pork Medallions with Fried Banana and Melon
description: Season the pork with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a nonstick skillet and sear the pork medallions on both sides. Pour in the stock and cream then stir in the curry powder. Simmer for 8-10 minutes in the sauce.

title: Colorful Vegetables and Rice
description: Rinse the broccoli. Rinse, halve and chop the peppers. Peel and finely chop the garlic. Rinse and cut the scallions into rings.

title: Baked Tomatoes Stuffed with Vegetable Rice
description: In a pan, heat about 1 tablespoon oil and sauté shallots, chile pepper and garlic for about 1-2 minutes until translucent. Rinse rice, drain and add rice, wine and broth to pan. Cover and reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes and cook until rice is al dente.

title: Chicken and Vegetable Rice Paper Rolls
description: Rinse the celery, carrots and scallions. Remove the strings from the celery and peel the carrots. Cut the celery into sticks. Shred the carrots and cut the scallion in half or in thirds. Rinse the lettuce leaves, pat dry and pluck into small pieces.

title: Risotto with Lemon
description: Finally, add the thyme, lemon juice and zest, half the Parmesan and butter, stirring well. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Reisbratlinge with Spring Onions
description: Rinse scallions and cut the white part into thin strips and the green part into rings.

title: Pork with Rice Noodles and Vegetables
description: Cook the pasta according to ipackage directions.

title: Asian Noodles with Vegetables
description: Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Rinse the green beans, trim, cut into 3-4 cm (approximately 1 to 1 1/2 inch) long pieces and blanch for about 8 minutes in salted water. Rinse the peppers, cut in half, trim and cut into thin strips.

title: Tomato Soup with Deep-Fried Rice Balls
description: For the soup: Peel the onion, garlic and carrot and cut into small dice. Heat oil in a pot and sauté the onion, garlic and carrot until starting to soften, 1-2 minutes. Rinse, core and cut the tomatoes into small pieces. Stir the tomato paste into the vegetables and add the tomatoes with the  herbs and broth. Simmer, stirring occasionally for 20 minutes.

title: Rice and Spinach Salad with Cheese and Mint
description: Rinse spinach and mint, shake dry and pluck leaves. Set aside some mint leaves for garnishing. Blanch the rest of mint with spinach briefly in salted water. Squeeze excess water and chop coarsely.

title: Fried Noodle-Wrapped King Prawns
description: Meanwhile, heat the oil in a pot or in the fryer to 170°C (approximately 325°F), (it is hot enough when a wooden spoon handle is inserted into the oil and  bubbles appear).

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Bring broth to a boil in a small pot, then reduce heat and keep warm. Heat butter in a pot over medium heat and saute onion until translucent. Add the risotto and saute briefly. Add white wine and cook, stirring, until evaporated. Ladle in about 150 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of hot broth and cook, stirring frequently, until almost all liquid is absorbed. Continue to add broth in this manner and cook until rice is al dente, about 20 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in the remaining butter and a half of the Parmesan. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Steamed Leek Trout
description: Rinse leek and slice lengthwise. Slice into rings and stuff into trout. Place trout and remaining leeks into a steaming basket. Bring vegetable broth to a boil, add rice and top with steaming basket. Cover and cook over medium heat for 20-25 minutes.

title: Arugula Risotto
description: Rinse the arugula (rocket) and chop coarsely.

title: Rice Paper Rolls with Vegetable Filling
description: Fill a shallow dish (slightly larger than the sheets of rice paper) with water. Spread a cloth in front of the dish and keep a second cloth handy. Dip sheets one at a time into the water and soak for about 1 minute. Then gently spread on the cloth and pat dry with a second cloth.

title: Rice with Tomatoes and Beans
description: Boil the rice in about 600 ml of well-salted water (approximately 2 1/2 cups). Add the onion and leave the rice to simmer for about 20 minutes until done.

title: Beans and Rice
description: Peel onions and garlic and finely chop. Rinse bell peppers, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs and also finely dice. Heat oil in a pot and saute bell peppers together with onion, garlic, tomato paste and oregano. Deglaze the pot with about 600 ml (approximately 20 ounces) of reserved bean broth. Rinse rice. Add rice, beans and bay leaf to the pot and season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 20 minutes until tender while stirring occasionally. As required, add water; however, all liquid should have been absorbed by the end.

title: Seafood Risotto
description: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a saucepan and saute the onion, fennel and garlic in it until soft. Add the arborio rice and saute briefly. Pour the white wine and the fish stock to cover the rice. Add the saffron with the soaking water, the bay leaf and lemon zest. Gradually pour the remaining fish stock and cook while stirring occasionally until the rice is creamy and cooked al dente, about 20 minutes.

title: Cellophane Noodle Salad
description: Place beans in salted water, blanch for about 8 minutes. Drain and halve or cut into thirds. Peel onions, halve and cut into thin strips. Peel and clean melon, cut into thin slices.

title: Risotto with Mushrooms and Leeks
description: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a saucepan and briefly sauté the leeks. Add the rice and sauté until coated. Add the white wine and cook until it's been absorbed. Add enough of the broth to cover the rice and cook, stirring occasionally and gradually adding more broth when it's been absorbed. Cook, stirring occasioanlly until the rice is creamy with a slight bite, about 20 minutes.

title: Green Bean and Savory Risotto with Ratatouille
description: Add the herbs, season with salt and pepper and simmer for about 10 minutes over medium heat. Season again.

title: Risotto with Bacon, Peppers and Capers
description: Meanwhile peel, halve and cut the onion into strips. Rinse the peppers, cut in half, remove the seeds and white ribs and cut into wide strips. Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a skillet and saute the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Add the onions and peppers to the pan and cook over low heat until tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.  Add the capers and bacon to the rice and mix. r

title: Classic Seafood Paella
description: Rinse the fish, pat dry and cut into bite-size pieces. Clean the mussels and discard any that opened. Loosen the half of the mussels from the shell and keep the rest as a garnish for the paella. Peel the onion and the garlic, finely chop. Rinse the tomatoes, cut out the stalks, quarter, remove seeds and cut into pieces. Rinse the pepper and the chile, remove seeds and ribs and cut into small cubes. Heat the oil in a large paella (paella pan), sauté the onion with the garlic. add the pepper and chile. Add the rice, mix and cook for a few minutes until the grains shine and look slightly glazed. Pour in the wine. Put in bay leaf and paprika, season with salt and pepper. Soften the saffron in 2 tablespoons hot broth, pour together with the remaining broth over the ingredients and cook about 10 minutes.

title: Chicken Salad with Rice
description: Leave the chicken to cool in the broth, then remove and cut into bite-size pieces. In a bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, creme fraiche, 2 tablespoons chicken broth, cumin, salt and pepper. Add the rice and chicken and mix to combine.  Finely chop the parsley and add it to the chicken. Halve the chile lengthwise, remove the seeds, very finely chop, and sprinkle over the salad.

title: Tex-Mex Stuffed Peppers
description: Fry the bacon in a skillet and then chop. Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit and dice the flesh.

title: Chicken and Rice with Mixed Vegetables
description: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large frying pan and sear the meat on all sides, around 3 minutes. Add the vegetables and sauté for 3 minutes. Add the rice and remaining oil, sauté over high heat, stirring often, for 5 minutes and season with salt and pepper.

title: Stuffed Peppers
description: Cut olives in half. Mix all ingredients with the cooked rice and season with salt and pepper. Scoop rice mixture into the peppers. Lightly salt the peppers and place in a roasting pan. Add some water, cover and simmer about 20 minutes. Serve.

title: Walnut Risotto
description: Briefly blanch the tomatoes, drain, peel, quarter, core and dice.

title: Fruit Rice Pudding
description: Pour the milk with the cinnamon stick in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Put in rice, sugar and salt and let soak, stirring occasionally, over medium heat for 20 minutes.

title: Rice with Shrimp
description: Serve with shrimp crackers (finished product) and fried onions, if desired.

title: Turkey Curry with Coconut Rice
description: Heat the oil in a skillet. Cut the turkey breast into strips, season with salt and pepper and saute briefly, then keep warm.

title: Rice Salad
description: Add orange and lemon juice to rice. Season with salt and pepper. Blanch tomatoes with hot water, rinse with cold water, peel, quarter, core and chop. Combine rice salad with herbs and diced tomatoes, garnish with mint, serve.

title: Clam Risotto
description: Pat dry clams and possibly halve. Briefly sauté shallot in a larger pot in 1 tablespoon butter, add clams and bay leaf, and pour in the remaining wine. Cover and let cook for about 3 minutes on medium heat.

title: Hawaiian-Style Rice with Ham and Pineapple
description: Mix together rice, ham and pineapple. Season with salt and pepper. Grate Parmesan cheese. Divide rice salad among bowls, top with cheese and parsley and serve.

title: Chicken Noodle Soup
description: Rinse celery and cut sticks and leaves small. Trim scallion and cut into thin rings. Rinse coriander and finely chop. Briefly dip rice noodles in boiling water and drain. Heat chicken broth. Add vinegar, sugar, fish sauce, soy sauce, star anise, radish and celery, and briefly boil.

title: Mushroom and Rice Soup
description: Rinse celery, carrots and scallion. Peel as necessary and chop finely.

title: Spring Rolls (vegetarian)
description: Cut cellophane noodles with scissors into about 5 cm (approximately 2 inches) long pieces and mix in a bowl with tofu, ginger, bok choy and chile pepper and season with Worcestershire sauce and salt.

title: Stuffed Cabbage Rolls
description: Remove whole leaves of cabbage. Cut out stalks and blanch leaves for 4-5 minutes in salted water. Remove, pat dry with paper towels and shock in ice water. Cut leek into long strips, blanch and shock in ice water.

title: Shrimp Summer Rolls
description: Rince and julienne celery. Rinse basil, shake dry and pluck leaves.
